Julita operates a bicycle parts business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells them per item with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantity and variety of bicycle spare parts and accessories to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Julita dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: To pay for supplies of bicycle spare parts and accessories

loan.name: Kelvin

texts.en: Kelvin 27, is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past year, he has operated a vegetable stall, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. The high cost of transportation incurred in bringing goods to his stall poses a major challenge. Kelvin dreams of establishing another business in the future. With his KES 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loan.name: Paso De Oro Group

texts.es: El comit辿 Paso de Oro es de la ciudad Lambar辿, el grupo de mujeres es de un humilde asentamiento en donde muchas se単oras ni siquiera cuentan con agua potable, servicio de energ鱈a el辿ctrica. Aun sin contar con estos servicios b叩sicos ellas emprenden diversas actividades microemprendedoras, para poder salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias. Juana es una de las miembros y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de verduras de todo tipo, un poco de esas que vende ella misma las planta, para que de esa forma le sea un poco m叩s barato. Ella cuenta que sustenta a su familia con mucho sacrificio. Desea poder darle a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Ella solicita el cr辿dito para la compra de verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas y dem叩s tipos, con lo cual podr叩 surtirse para sus clientes
texts.en:
The communal bank Paso de Oro is in the city of Lambar辿, its members are a group of women who live in a poor settlement and many of them do not even have access to drinking water and electrical power supply. Even though they lack these basic utilities, these women establish different micro-enterprising businesses in order to get ahead in life and support their families.
Juana is one of the female members and tells us she sells all kinds of vegetables for a living. She grows some of the vegetables herself, so it is cheaper. She says she works really hard to support her family and wishes to give her family everything that she was not able to have.
She wants this loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green pepper, onions, etc. to sell them to her customers.

loan.use: To buy tomatoes, green pepper, onions and other vegetables.

loan.name: Norma Piedad

texts.es:
Norma Piedad tiene 26 a単os de estado civil en Union Libre con el compa単ero y con los hijos . Vive en el Cant坦n Ventanas provincia de Los R鱈os.
La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los ngeles, pertenecientes al Cant坦n Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agr鱈colas de ciclo corto siembra de ma鱈z y arroz.
Norma Piedad se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de ma鱈z y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.
El cr辿dito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, l鱈quidos fertilizantes para la siembra del ma鱈z y arroz. El pr辿stamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sue単o es tener un negocio propio y comprar una finca.
Le gusta trabajar en el campo y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Norma Piedad is 26 years old and lives with her partner of common law marriage and her children. She lives in Ventanas canton in the province of Los R鱈os.
The 'Ciudadela Los ngeles' community bank is located in Los ngeles, in Ventanas canton. The members of the bank grow corn and rice.
Norma Piedad makes a living growing corn and rice. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in Ventanas and also in the fairs that are close by.
She requested the loan to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizers to plant corn and rice. The loan helped her to increase her profits used for family consumption and for investment. Her dream is to have her own business and to buy a farm.
She likes to work in the fields and to spend time with her family.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers.

loan.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.
Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to get a bigger room from where she can sell her charcoal and also to sell wholesale. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loan.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice, 50, is a married man with six children, four of whom still attend school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past two years, he has operated a fish selling business; his clients are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop to sell fish in the future. With his KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loan.name: Rena

texts.en: Rena is 34 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. They have five children between 4 and 15 years old who live at home and attend school. For the past nine years, Rena has been selling dried Bonnie fish in the market. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried Bonnie fish for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loan.use: to purchase more dried Bonnie fish for her business

loan.name: Mujeres Sobresalientes Group

texts.es: El comit辿 se denomina Mujeres Sobresalientes, est叩 constituido por 14 se単oras muy activas y solidarias, quienes son de Ciudad del Este. Ellas tienen actividades diferentes, algunas emprender叩n una nueva labor y se encuentran muy entusiasmadas. Emilia es una mujer que tiene muchas metas y sue単os, y es en mira a estos que se uni坦 al programa de la fundaci坦n, ya que vio en este una gran oportunidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza que ella hace artesanalmente y comenta que le va bien, ya que es un poco m叩s econ坦mico que los productos que se venden en las tiendas y eso la ayuda. Solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundaci坦n paraguaya para la compra de los insumos necesarios para hacer sus productos, como ser cloro, lavandinas, colorantes, aromatizantes y dem叩s.
texts.en:
The committee is called Mujeres Sobresalientes (Outstanding Women) and its composed of 14 very active, supportive women from Ciudad del Este. They have different activities and some will be starting new businesses; they are very excited.
Emilia is a woman with many goals and this is why she joined the Fundaci坦n since she saw a great opportunity in doing so. She sells cleaning supplies that she makes in an artisanal way. She comments that she does well since its a bit more economical product compared to those sold in stores and this helps her.
She is asking help from Kiva and Fundaci坦n Paraguaya to buy the necessary supplies to make her products like chlorine bleach, bleach, coloring agents, fresheners, etc.

loan.use: to buy chlorine bleach, bleach, dyes, fresheners, etc.

loan.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent, aged 24, is single and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumption.
For the past six years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Milicent dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.
With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loan.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther de 29 a単os est叩 casada con Rafael, con quien tiene a sus 3 hijos de 9 y 5 a単os y un peque単o beb辿 de 9 meses de nacido. Ella y su familia viven en una casa alquilada en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas, provincia de Tarma. San Pedro de Cajas es el pueblo de artesanos de Tarma. Los turistas nacionales e internacionales visitan la zona para llevarse bellos recuerdos. Esther no pierde esta oportunidad, as鱈 que gracias a sus estudios en artes, ahora se dedica a la artesan鱈a. Hace 10 a単os empez坦 con esta actividad junto a Rafael, ya que ambos se desenvuelven en el mismo oficio. Esther confecciona chompas, chalinas, frazadas, chalinas, etc., con dise単os creativos. As鱈 tambi辿n realiza cuadros en 坦leo y pinturas. El telar y los cuadros son rentables, pero de donde obtengo m叩s ganancias es de las pinturas, menciona. La competencia en los tejidos hace que gane apenas 5 坦 10 soles por chompas, pero en las frazadas gana muy bien. Pero no hay nada comparado con los cuadros, que son los m叩s solicitados. Gana de 120 a 150 soles por cada pintura de 1 metro por 1 metro y m叩s a炭n en los d鱈as de semana santa. Le gusta lo que hace. Esther quiere instalar un stand en el centro c鱈vico de su distrito, para eso deber叩 invertir en la compra de estantes, contenedores, anaqueles y en el mismo alquiler del local. Esther es una socia fiel de MFP, lleva trabajando 3 ciclos en un cr辿dito grupal, del que le va de maravilla. ste ser鱈a su primer cr辿dito individual, manifiesta ser puntual en los pagos como ahora. Esther desea abrir una galer鱈a en el centro c鱈vico de su distrito, donde vender叩 su artesan鱈a. Para implementar el local invertir叩 en la compra de estantes y anaqueles para ofrecer sus productos. As鱈 como tambi辿n pagar el alquiler inicial del espacio.
texts.en:
Esther, 29, is married to Rafael with whom she has three children who are 9 and 5 years old and a baby who is 9 months old. She and her family live in a rented house in San Pedro de Cajas District, Tarma Province.
San Pedro de Cajas is Tarmas crafts town. National and international tourists visit the zone to take away beautiful souvenirs. Esther does not pass up this opportunity; thanks to her art studies, shes a craftswoman. She started this activity ten years ago with Rafael since they both are in the same occupation.
Esther makes sweaters with creative designs, shawls, blankets, etc. She also makes oil and other paint paintings. She mentions that: The weaving and the paintings are profitable but where I obtain the highest profits is with the paintings. Competition in weaving means barely earning 5 or 10 soles per sweater but with the blankets she earns very well. But theres nothing to compare to the paintings which are in most demand. She earns from 120 to 150 soles per 1 meter x 1 meter painting and even more during Holy Week. She enjoys what she does.
Esther wants to set up a stand in her districts civic center but to do so she has to invest in the purchase of shelving, containers, and display cases as well as to rent the locale. Esther is a faithful MFP client; shes been working in three cycles of group loans where shes done marvelously. This would be her first individual loan and she states that she will be punctual with her payments like shes been to date. Esther wants to open a gallery in her districts civic center to sell her crafts. To furnish the site she will buy shelving and display cases to offer her products; she will also pay the initial rental costs of the space.

loan.use: to rent a locale and to buy display cases and shelving.

loan.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is 27 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and has two children between one and four years old. They live at home and the children attend school. For the past ten years she has been selling used clothes. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loan.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loan.name: Nicol叩s

texts.es: Todos los d鱈as la vida de Nicol叩s transcurren en la pr叩ctica de una caminata diaria de 2 horas y esto no lo hace por Hobbie, aunque si con una gran alegr鱈a: Nicol叩s se desempe単a en su negocio de vender los deliciosos y jugosos aguacates que le traen del Carmen, en el departamento de Bol鱈var y limones cultivados a lo largo del Rio Magdalena, loa cuales traslada en una carretilla rebosada del verde color de estas frutas, que entrega directamente en las manos de sus clientes, ubicados en una urbanizaci坦n muy lejana cerca a las Playas de la ciudad. Nicol叩s se despierta bien temprano, llena su carretilla de aguacates y limones y se va a visitar a sus clientes; a ellos los tiene acostumbrados a recibir las frutas en la puerta de su casa, que entrega mediante una conversaci坦n amena y muy Caribe. Con esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, conformada por su c坦nyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 18 a 32 a単os. Nicol叩s fue educado por su abuela y desde los 13 a単os est叩 trabajando, primero lo hizo vendiendo cocadas, o dulces elaborados a base de coco y/o guayaba, luego trabaj坦 ayudando a los vendedores de frutas y posteriormente, cuando conform坦 su familia y con la suficiente experiencia, emprendi坦 su sue単o de ser independiente. Es por esto que desde hace 5 a単os, trabaja persistentemente en su propio negocio, teniendo como norte lograr bienestar para su familia, dispuesto a que en un futuro no pasen trabajo, como el mismo lo dice. Como la meta de Nicol叩s es tener un dep坦sito o local donde conservar las frutas, gradualmente necesita crecer, aumentando su clientela y su capacidad de comercializaci坦n. Esta es la raz坦n por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaci坦n Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprar叩 en mayor volumen y de contado aguacates y limones, para disminuir los precios del producto, pues compra diario con dinero de cr辿dito informal y altamente costoso y con ello para poder sostenerse, incrementa el precio del producto, raz坦n por la cual est叩 en condiciones desiguales en el mercado; esto es posible solucionarlo con credikiva , financiaci坦n que planea seria exitosa porque aprovechar鱈a los costos de oportunidad, debido a que tendr鱈a un capital para negociar por vol炭menes y de contado y lograr鱈a acceder a precios de productos sostenibles, que as鱈 mismo trasladar叩 a sus clientes, haciendo que su negocio sea mas competitivo.
texts.en:
Every day, Nicol叩ss life includes a daily 2-hour walk and he doesnt do this as a hobby although he does do it joyfully. Nicol叩s sells delicious, juicy avocadoes that they bring him from El Carmen in Bol鱈var Department and lemons farmed along the Magdalena River which he transports in a wheelbarrow lush with the green color of these fruits that he delivers directly into the hands of his customers located in a settlement quite far from the citys beaches. Nicol叩s wakes up very early, fills up his wheelbarrow with avocadoes and lemons and heads out to visit his customers. He has accustomed them to receive their fruit at their doorsteps, a delivery he carries out with a very enjoyable, Caribbean conversation. With this activity hes managed to support his family which consists of his spouse and four children ranging in age from 18 to 32.
Nicol叩s was educated by his grandmother and has been working since he was 13 years old. First he worked selling cocadas, candy made from coconut and/or guava. Then he worked helping fruit merchants and still later when he formed his own family and with the gained experience, he started his dream of being independent. Because of this, for the last five years he has worked persistently in his own business his guiding star being is familys wellbeing. As he himself says, hes determined that they should not have to go through struggles in the future.
Since Nicolass goal is to have a warehouse or depository to keep his fruit, he gradually needs to grow increasing his clientele and his capacity for sales. This is why hes calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundaci坦n Mario Santo Domingo, that he will use to pay cash for larger amounts of avocadoes and lemons so he can reduce the price he pays since he currently buys daily with money from informal loans which is extremely expensive but this is the way hes be able to stay in business but the price of his products increases leaving him at a disadvantage in the marketplace. All of this can be solved with a Kiva loan, financing he hopes will be successful because he will be able to take advantage of special promotional prices because hell have capital with which to negotiate cash payments for volume purchases thus obtaining sustainable product prices that he can pass on to his customers making his business more competitive.

loan.use: to pay cash for large amounts of avocadoes and lemons.

loan.name: Nexar Octavio

texts.es:
Nexar Octavio tiene 26 a単os de estado civil Union Libre vive con la compa単era y con un hijo de 6 a単os. Vive en el Cant坦n Ventanas provincia de Los R鱈os.
La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San Jos辿, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cant坦n Ventanas se dedican a labores agr鱈colas como la siembra de ma鱈z.
Nexar Octavio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de ma鱈z. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.
El cr辿dito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, l鱈quidos fertilizantes para la siembra del ma鱈z. El pr辿stamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sue単o es tener dinero para comprar una casda para la familia.
Le gusta salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Nexar Octavio is 26 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner and a 6-year-old son. He lives in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los R鱈os. The communal bank "14 DE DICIEMBRE" is made up of 15 members of the cooperative of San Jos辿. It is located in the San Vicente precinct, belonging to the canton of Ventanas. The members undertake agricultural labors such as sowing corn.
Nexar Octavio works in agriculture, sowing corn. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the same markets and in fairs in the surrounding area. The loan is requested for the purchase of fertilzer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for sowing corn. The loan will help him increase his earnings to be used by his family and to invest. His dream is to have money to buy a house for his family. He likes to go out with his family.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and fertilizing liquids.

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina de 46 a単os. Es una madre soltera, de 7 hijos, 4 de ellos ya independientes, mientras que 3, de 16, 14 y 4 a単os a炭n viven con ella. Su casa propia y se ubica en la comunidad de Zona Patria, provincia de Chanchamayo. Alejandrina es una madre ejemplar. Su trabajo requiere mucho esfuerzo y constancia. La agricultura es su actividad econ坦mica desde que sali坦 embarazada de su primer hijo. De esa manera cuido, aliment坦 y educ坦 a sus hijos mayores, y es lo que hace con los que a炭n tiene en su poder. En retribuci坦n de tanto cari単o, ahora sus hijos la apoyan en las faenas del campo. Alejandrina cuenta con 4 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, en 2 de ellas el caf辿 crece verde y sano, y en las otras 2 restantes los pl叩tanos arrojan buenos frutos. La 炭ltima cosecha de caf辿 saque como 50 sacos de caf辿. Si me fue bien, para este a単o cosechar辿 como 70, comenta alegre. A pesar de contar con la ayuda de sus hijos, necesita m叩s manos para limpiar y machetear la maleza o m叩s yerbas que crecen entre sus cafetales. Para eso, ella invierte en el pago de operarios. Gracias a su ayuda, ella podr鱈a acceder叩 su pr辿stamo n炭mero 7 de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. A la vez menciona sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, por que muchas veces la sac坦 de apuros. De obtener el dinero contratar叩 a los jornaleros quienes limpiar叩n sus parcelas de las malas yerbas.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 46 years of age. She is a single mother of seven children, four of whom are already grown up and independent, while the other three, aged 16, 14 and 4, still live with her. She owns her own home, which is located in the community of Zona Patria in the province of Chanchamayo.
Alejandrina is a model mother. Her work requires great effort and consistency. She has made her living in agriculture since she became pregnant with her first child. Through this work, she raised and educated her grown children, and is likewise doing these things for her children that are still in her care.
In return for such care, her children now support her by working on the farm. She has four plots of land that she cultivates. In two of them she grows healthy, green coffee bushes, and in the other two she has banana trees that bear good fruit.
The last harvest brought 50 sacks of coffee. Things have gone well, for this year I will harvest 70 sacks, she says. Even with the help of her children, she still needs more hands to clean out the undergrowth and weeds that grow between her coffee bushes. For this, she hires workers.
Thanks to your help, she will be able to obtain her seventh loan from MFP. She promises to be punctual in making her monthly payments. She also says that she is grateful for her communal bank, because many times it has helped her when she is under pressure. She will use the loan proceeds to hire laborers who will clear her plots of weeds.

loan.use: to hire laborers.

loan.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 34 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children between 6 and 19 years old who live at home and attend school. For the past eight years, Comfort has been selling cosmetics. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loan.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loan.name: Franz

texts.es: Franz de 25 a単os es un joven soltero, vive con sus padres en una casa propia en la localidad de Zona Patria en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Franz es un hombre laborioso. Hace 10 a単os que de dedica a la agricultura. Con la ayuda de sus padres produce caf辿 y pl叩tanos en sus 2 hect叩reas de terrenos de cultivos. Le parece rentable la venta de ambos frutos, el caf辿 de cosecha anual le genera ingresos m叩s que provechosos; el pl叩tano le arroja dinero cada quince d鱈as. De toda la venta de pl叩tanos estoy sacando como 250 soles, comenta. A la vez tambi辿n trabaja en un aserradero como ayudante, ah鱈 gana uno 180 soles semanales. Le va muy bien. Pero le gustar鱈a ampliar su producci坦n por que piensa como emprendedor. Sus ingresos depender叩n de su esfuerzo. En el futuro se comprar叩 un terreno cerca de su zona, con tierras f辿rtiles para aumentar su producci坦n de caf辿. ste ser鱈a su pr辿stamo n炭mero 7 de MFP, que obtendr鱈a gracias a su ayuda. Confirma que ser叩 puntual en el pago de las cuotas, como lo fue antes. Mujeres al futuro, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho con los resultados obtenidos como grupo. De obtener el dinero podr叩 comprar 10 bolsas de abonos org叩nicos para sus plantaciones de caf辿.
texts.en:
Franz is 25 years old, and is a single young man. He lives with his parents in their own home in the Zona Patria part of Chanchamayo province.
Franz is an industrious man, who has been working in farming for the last 10 years. With the help of his parents, he produces coffee and plantains on his two hectares of farmland. The sale of both crops seems to be profitable; his annual coffee harvest is more than profitable, and the plantains earn him money every two weeks. "From all the plantain sales, I'm taking about 250 soles", he comments.
At the same time, Franz also works as an assistant at a sawmill, where he earns 180 soles every two weeks. It's going very well for him, but he would like to increase his production as he believes that as an entrepreneur, his income will depend on his effort. In the future he will purchase some land nearby, with fertile soil for increasing his coffee production.
This will be his seventh loan with MFP, which he will obtain thanks to your support. He confirms that he will be punctual in his repayments, just as he has been previously.
"Mujeres al Futuro" ["Women to the Future"] is the name of his communal bank. He is satisfied with the results obtained by the group.
By obtaining the money, he will be able to purchase 10 bags of organic manure for his coffee plantations.

loan.use: to purchase 10 bags of organic manure.

loan.name: Victor Santiago

texts.es:
VICTOR SANTIAGO tiene 63 a単os de estado civil Soltero vive tiene 4 hijos pero no viven con el. Vive en el Cant坦n Ventanas provincia de Los R鱈os.
La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San Jos辿, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cant坦n Ventanas se dedican a labores agr鱈colas como la siembra de ma鱈z.
VICTOR SANTIAGO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de ma鱈z. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.
El cr辿dito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, l鱈quidos fertilizantes para la siembra del ma鱈z. El pr辿stamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sue単o es comprar un terreno para construir una casa.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver la television.
texts.en:
V鱈ctor Santiago is 63 years old and single. He has four children but they do not live with him. He lives in Cant坦n Ventanas, located in Los R鱈os province.
The communal bank, called 14 de Diciembre, comprises fifteen members from Cooperativa San Jos辿 and is located in the San Vicente de las Lomas area which belongs to Ventanas Canton. They work in the farm performing various tasks, such as planting corn.
V鱈ctor Santiago is a farm worker and plants corn. He buys his products with Ventanas (a unique loan which uses a group guarantee but is an individual loan with a savings component) and later sells them in the local marketplace and fairs nearby.
He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer and urea to plant corn. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to increase his income and provide for his family. His dream is to buy a plot of land to build his own home. He enjoys watching television in his spare time.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and urea.

loan.name: Road To Success Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group. He was born in Malal Marah, a big village in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty five years of age. Mohamed is married to a petty trader and the couple has four children together three in primary school and one in secondary.
For many years now, Mohamed has been selling used bags. He and his teammate have requested a loan of 1,500,000.00 SLL each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand the size and qualities of their respective businesses. Mohamed is going to use his loan to buy a bale of used bags to add to his stall inventory.

loan.use: to buy a bale of used bags to add to his stall

loan.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila lives in Pavlograd and sells drinks and bakery items in the central city market. She is a married mom. Her husband is a coal miner and her son Artyom is 15 and goes to school.
After graduation from medical college, Ludmila worked as a nurse. However, she was laid off and decided to try her luck as an entrepreneur. Today, Ludmilas vending location is well known in the market because the inventory she offers for sale is always fresh and of good quality. She has been in business for 6 years.
Ludmila is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to purchase additional merchandise that would increase her family income. Some of Ludmila's long-term plans are to purchase additional equipment for her kiosk, such as a refrigerator and a microwave.

loan.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loan.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
Baby is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. A native of Sanda Tandarin village in Northern Sierra Leone, Baby is thirty eight years old. She is married to a fisherman and the couple has five children together. Three of their children are attending primary school, one is in secondary school, and the other is in college.
Baby has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells drinks, tied plastic water, plastic bags, etc. With the help of this loan, Baby and her teammates will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Baby will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current inventory.

loan.use: to buy drinks, tied plastic water, and plastic bags in bulk to add to her inventory

loan.name: Fedor

texts.ru:
个亠亟仂 仆亢仆 亟仂仗仂仍仆亳亠仍仆亠 亠亟于舒 仆舒 仗仂从仗从 亠仄礌 亳 仗仍亠仆从亳. 于磶亳 仂仂仄 亠仆 仆舒 亳 仂于舒, 亠亞仂 弍亳亰仆亠 弍亠亠亢亠仆亳亶 仆亠 于舒舒亠. 仂仍亠亠 仂亞仂, 个亠亟仂 亳舒亠, 仂 仗仂仍亰仂于舒 弍亳亰仆亠 从亠亟亳仂仄 亟仂弍仆仂 亳 于亞仂亟仆仂.
仗仂仍仂仄 亞仂亟 个亠亟仂 舒从亢亠 弍舒仍 从亠亟亳 仆舒 仗仍亠仆从, 亠仄亠仆舒 亳 亟仂弍亠仆亳. 丕仂亢舒亶 弍仍 仂仂亳亶, 仆仂 仆亠仄仆仂亞仂 仗仂亰亟仆亳亶, 仗仂仂仄 弍仍 舒仗仂亟舒仆 仗仂 弍仂仍亠亠 仆亳亰从仂亶 亠仆亠, 于 于磶亳 亠仄 于亠仍亳亳 仗亳弍仍 仆亠 亟舒仍仂.

texts.en: Fedor need additional means to buy seeds and greenhouse film. Because the prices for these goods have been going up, savings from his business are not enough. In addition, Fedor believes that taking out a business loan is convenient and advantageous. Last year Fedor also took out a loan to buy greenhouse film, seeds and fertilizers. His harvest was good, but somewhat late, therefore the produce was sold for a lower price, and Fedor did not manage to increase his revenues. Last year Fedor had his car repaired (it was necessary to buy many spare parts) and made some minor repairs in the house. Fedor has an additional source of income, since he performs welding jobs during construction of greenhouses, and he always many work orders.

loan.use: to buy seeds and greenhouse film

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy clothes in large quantity to add to her business

loan.name: Teko Sanda Traders Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Teko Sanda Traders group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,200,000.00 Sierra Leone leone (SLL) for each in order to invest in their businesses.
Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is age 23 and is married with one child. Her husband is a military officer, and her child is still not of school-going age.
Fatmata retails cooking oil, flour, sugar, onions, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying cooking oil, flour, sugar, onions, etc., in large quantities to add to her business.

loan.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar, onions, etc., in large quantities to add to her business.

loan.name: Debora Antonia

texts.es: Debora es una emprendedora que tiene objetivos y metas en la vida, su negocio de la venta de mercader鱈a en general lo realiza de forma ambulante en lo cual sus clientes la buscan por la calidad de producto y servicio que le brindan a sus clientes. Ella es clienta de Fundaci坦n Le坦n 2000,lo cual es una clienta que tiene un record intachable, el cr辿dito que se le brindo anteriormente fue para la compra de mercader鱈a. Actualmente est叩 solicitando financiamiento para la comprar mercader鱈a en general para as鱈 ofr辿cele a sus clientes variedad.
texts.en:
Debora is a businesswoman with objectives and goals in life. In her business as a street vendor she sells general merchandise, and her customers seek her out for the quality of her products and the service that she offers them.
Debora is a member of Fundaci坦n Le坦n 2000 and she has an impeccable record. Her previous loan was for the purchase of merchandise. Currently she is requesting financing to buy general merchandise to offer her clients variety.

loan.use: to buy a variety of merchandise.

loan.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Jos辿 Santos tiene 57 a単os de edad, el negocio al que se dedica es un taller de radio t辿cnico. El negocio consiste en un taller donde se dan mantenimiento y reparaciones a televisores, equipos de sonido, DVD entre otros, as鱈 como tambi辿n venta de repuestos facilit叩ndole y asegur叩ndole al cliente la reparaci坦n del artefacto. Este negocio Jos辿 lo aprendi坦 desde muy joven ya que sus padres no tuvieron lo suficiente dinero para pagarles sus estudios y tuvo que trabajar para apoyarlos en los gastos del hogar. Jos辿 Santos est叩 solicitando financiamiento para capital trabajo.
texts.en: Jos辿 Santos is 57 years old. The business hes in is an electronics repair shop. It consists of a workshop where he repairs and services television sets, sound equipment and DVD players, among others as well as the sale of spare parts easing and insuring repair of the customers appliance. Jos辿 learned this business while still young because his parents did not have enough money to pay for his schooling and he had to go to work to help them with household expenses. Jos辿 Santos is asking for financing to use as working capital.

loan.use: to use as working capital.

loan.name: Amor A Cristo 3 Group

texts.en:
Angela is the coordinator of her group, Amor a Cristo 3 (Love to Christ). She lives in a simple structure with her husband and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to repay this loan as she likes to repay well. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying working. Angela is dreaming of travelling to the United States and of having a successful business.
Angela is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She is running a miscellaneous stall. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes, pairs of shoes, cosmetics, etc. She also will invest in her fruit and vegetable stall by buying pineapples, oranges, bananas, papayas and vegetables. She started her business 18 years ago; at that time she only had fruit and vegetables. She will use her business profits to reinvest in her business. This group is located in a zone of few resources in the city of Santiago, which is one of the most populated in the Dominican Republic. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loan.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, vegetables and fruit

loan.name: Mujeres Al Poder 4 Group

texts.en:
Lesbia is the coordinator of the Mujeres Al Poder 4 (women in power) Group. The members live in the slums located to the north of Santo Domingo. This group is located in one of the poorest communities to the north of Santo Domingo. Lesbia sells silver jewelry. This is the first loan she has requested from Esperanza, and she is planning to purchase rings, necklaces, bracelets, earrings and other accessories. She is very excited about this loan which makes it possible to reinvest in her business and expand her sales into more products and clients.
Lesbia tells us that her challenges have been to start her business and to study. For her business, she saved a small amount of money and bought some accessories almost a year ago. She is the mother of a child and they live together with her long-term partner. Her business profits will be used to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loan.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell

loan.name: Por Fe Vivimos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Clara is one of the members of the Por Fe Vivimos 1, 2 & 3 (By Faith We Live) Group, located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. This group, comprised of 15 members, are dedicated to selling different products all over their rural community and visiting some others nearby.
Clara makes bags of food, with many different meals, and then she sells them for biweekly payments according to the days of most companies' payroll days. People make credit purchases and then pay her in one or two payments during a month. With this loan, she is planning to buy ingredients for different meals to prepare the food packages.
This is Clara's twelfth loan. She has been taking out loans for about eight years and has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She started her business after she took out her first Esperanza loan. With her business and the loans, she has increased her income and capital to improve her business and her life.
She is a divorced mother with two children. She cares for and works for their needs. Clara's dream is to continue improving her business. She is planning to reinvest her profits in the business and save. She thanks all of you for your support!!

loan.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, canned food, etc.

loan.name: G.s. Montes De Los Olivos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Montes de los Olivos, est叩 conformado por 2 emprendedoras que se unieron para apoyarse y motivarse una a otras, ellas son clientas de Fundaci坦n Le坦n 2000, en el cual son personas responsable y con deseo de salir adelante. Sof鱈a que es una de las miembros del grupos su actividad es la venta de frijoles cosidos en el cual est叩 solicitando financiamiento nuevamente para comprar capital trabajo para el negocio.
texts.en: The Montes de los Olivos support group is made up of 2 entrepreneurs who got together to support and motivate each other. They are clients of Fundaci坦n Le坦n 2000. They are responsible people who want to get ahead. Sof鱈a is one of the members of the group. Her activity is selling cooked beans. She is asking for a loan again to buy working capital for the business.

loan.use: to buy working capital for the business.

loan.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is 31 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin. She is married with five children. Lowela has a store that sells a variety of products. Lowela has had this business for 11 years.
She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Lowela has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 2,500 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Lorna has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell

Roselyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost two months. In the future, Annie hopes that she can improve her family's standard of living, and earn more than she needs.

Victor has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Victor hopes to expand his business.

Jonah has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Jonah hopes to own a piggery and save more money because she wants her three children to finish their studies so they can have a good future. Jonah has a strong personality and she takes good care of her children.

loan.use: to purchase more feed for her hog-raising business.

Juanita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Juanita hopes to have a lot of capital in order to earn money. Juanita wants to buy a space in the market where her business is.

loan.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

In the future, Mila hopes to improve her living situation.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer for her corn and banana plantation.

texts.en:

She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ligaya hopes to improve her living situation so that she can provide for the basic needs of her family and especially the education of her children.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer for her corn plantation.

In the future, Allan hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Vladimir

texts.ru: 仍舒亟亳仄亳 弍舒仍 仗仂仍亶 从亠亟亳 亟仍 亠仄仂仆舒 亠仗仍亳, 舒 舒从亢亠 仆舒 仗仍亠仆从 亳 亠仄亠仆舒. 仂仄 亞仂亟 亟仂仂亟 于亠仍亳亳仍 亟仂 90 000 亞亳于亠仆. 弌亠亶舒 仍舒亟亳仄亳 仆亢仆仂 亞仂仂于亳 亠仗仍亳 从 于舒亟从亠 亳 于仂亳 亠亟于 仆亠 于舒舒亠, 仗仂仂仄 仂仆 仂弍舒舒亠 亰舒 亳仆舒仆仂于仂亶 仗仂仄仂 于 . 仍舒亟亳仄亳 仗仍舒仆亳亠 亰舒从仗亳 仗仍亠仆从 仆舒 10 000 亞亳于亠仆, 亟仂弍亠仆亳 仆舒 2 000亞亳于亠仆 亳 亠仄亠仆舒 仆舒 8 000 亞亳于亠仆. 仆 仂亠 仗仂舒亟亳 仂亞 亳 仗仂仄亳亟仂, 亟仂仂亟 仆舒仆亠 仗仂仍舒 于 仄舒亠, 舒 仗亳弍仍 仗仂亶亟亠 仍亠仂仄. 仂 仍舒亟亳仄亳舒 于 仂仄 亞仂亟 亰舒从舒仆亳于舒亠 亠弍 于 丕亠. 弌舒舒 亟仂 亰舒仄亢亠仄, 亠 于仆从亳.
texts.en: Vladimir took out a loan last year to repair his greenhouses as well as to purchase greenhouse plastic film and seeds. His income has increased up to 90,000 hryvnia this year. Vladimir turns to KIVA for financial aid because he needs to prepare his greenhouses for planting and does not have enough money. Vladimir is planning on purchasing the greenhouse plastic film, fertilizers and seeds for the amounts of 10,000 hryvnia (UAH), 2,000 hryvnia (UAH) and 8,000 hryvnia (UAH), respectively. He wants to plant cucumbers and tomatoes. Vladimir will start getting the income in May and making the profit in summer. Vladimir's daughter will graduate from the university this year. His eldest daughter is married. Vladimir has grandchildren.

loan.use: to purchase greenhouse plastic film, fertilizers and seeds for the amounts of 10,000 hryvnia (UAH), 2,000 hryvnia and 8,000 hryvnia, respectively.

loan.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Benjamin is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Benjamin hopes to improve his services.

loan.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loan.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children.
Azucena has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.
Azucena has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Azucena hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop.

loan.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Natividad has a shop that sells clothing such as jackets, shirts and personal accessories like hair clips and pins. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy clothing and personal accessories to sell.
Natividad has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Natividad hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy clothing and personal accessories to sell.

loan.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 28-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
Lorna has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like chicken and pork adobo and afritada. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.
Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loan.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 26-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
Ana has a shop that sells vegetables, spices and food seasonings. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy vegetables, spices and food seasonings.
Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business

loan.use: to buy vegetables, spices and food seasonings.

loan.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 33-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
Elena has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2001. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Noralyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Noralyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Noralyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children.
Pacita has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes, banana cakes and sugar coated rice or suman. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients so she can make snacks to sell.
Pacita has been a member of HSPFI since 2002. In the future, Pacita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell.

loan.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Tessie has a shop that sells jewelry like silver plated necklaces and bracelets. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of jewelry to sell.
Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of jewelry to sell.

loan.name: Marjohn

texts.en:
Marjohn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
Marjohn is providing motorela or motorcycle service. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.
Marjohn has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Marjohn hopes to improve his services.

loan.use: to buy tools and gasoline for his motorcycle service.

loan.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
Noel fishes and sells the fish he catches in the market. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy materials he needs for his fishing boat.
Noel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business

loan.use: to buy materials for his fishing boat.

loan.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Vergie has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Vergie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vergie hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Cerilina

texts.en:
Cerilina is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
Cerilina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Cerilina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cerilina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Ursalina

texts.en:
Ursalina is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
Ursalina has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.
Ursalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ursalina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loan.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
Denia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and dried fish. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, dried fish and beverages.
Denia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Denia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, dried fish and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child.
Leonardo fishes and sells his catch at the public market. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy materials and tools to maintain his fishing boat.
Leonardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonardo hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy materials and tools to maintain his fishing boat.

loan.name: Rosalin

texts.en:
Rosalin is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
Rosalin has a shop that sells coconuts for copra and green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.
Rosalin has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalin hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loan.name: Sagrado

texts.en:
Sagrado is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children.
Sagrado has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines and milk fish. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell.
Sagrado has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sagrado hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell.

loan.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
Janette has a shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel and trout. She and her husband peddle the fish using their motorcycle. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell.
Janette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janette hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell.

loan.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Jovelyn has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She also runs a retail store. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.
Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loan.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
Jovelyn buys and sells fish in the community. She has had this business for two years.
She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy fish to resell.
Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell.

loan.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
Mary Jean has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for 15 years.
She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.
Mary Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Jean hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

loan.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has two children.
Jovy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.
She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Romelo

texts.en:
Romelo is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has five children.
Romelo has a shop that sells fish like trout and sardines. He has had this business for 10 years.
He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy fish to resell.
Romelo has been a member of HSPFI for since 2010. In the future, Romelo hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell.

loan.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has six children.
Edna has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.
She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
Evangeline has a shop that sells fish like sardines and trout. She has had this business for 20 years.
She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish to resell.
Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell.

loan.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children.
Rowena has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years.
She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Isaaf

texts.en:
Isaaf is a 43-year-old single lady who started working in 2002 as a tailor at a tailoring shop for three months then decided to start her own business on her own.
In 2002, Isaaf bought a sewing machine and started sewing and tailoring clothes for people at her home. Little by little, she was able to expand and open her own tailoring shop.
Now Isaaf has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine and work on expanding more.

loan.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loan.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda, a 47-year-old married woman, has a son and a daughter. Her husband has retired from his job after he had an accident that left him with one leg.
After her husband retired, the family was left with no income to support them except the retirement salary, so Majeda had to start sewing and embroidering Palestinian traditional dresses and used the same embroidery drawings to make bags, pillow covers and other items.
Now Majeda has applied for a loan to buy a special sewing machine that could help accelerate her work so she can be able to take more orders and one day open her own workshop.

loan.use: to buy a special sewing machine.

loan.name: Filipenses 4:13 Group

texts.en:
Jeannette is the coordinator of her group, which is called Filipenses 4:13 (Philippians). The group is made up of five women who run their own businesses in the town of Puerto Plata, a tourist center in the north of the country. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children and her long term partner.
Jeannette runs a little cafeteria, where she sells "empanadas and pastelitos", both are dough made of flour and filled with meat or vegetables, then fried to be sold as a snack. Empanada are made in the shape of a half moon and pastelitos are round. She will use this loan to buy goods like flour, cooking oil, meat, butter, eggs and vegetables.
This is Jeannetes first loan with Esperanza International. She has been running her business for the past two years, when she started making pastelitos and selling them from her house to all her neighbors and around the school. Now she has a cafeteria, and she sells other products. She is planning to reinvest her business profits.
Her most difficult challenge is to give credit to her clients. Jeannette dreams to have a prosperous and successful business. Thank you for lending to Jeannette and the Mujeres con Propositos group!

loan.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, meat, butter, eggs and vegetables.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy ten bags of maize.

loan.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Sixty-five-year old Japheth is married and a father to many children who are all above 18 years of age. He is in the business of selling animal feed in a shop and he has done this business for the past 30 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.
He has applied for a loan that he will be using to expand his business by adding more animal feed for sale. He hopes that the profits will scale up from this business boost so that he can make more profit.
His dream is to start a company of his own.

loan.use: to expand his business by buying animal feed for his shop.

loan.name: Phile

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year old Phile is a married woman with three children, ages 16, 13 and 9 years, respectively. She has been in the motorcycle transport business for 2 years and earns from it a monthly income of between 12,000 and 18,000 KES.
She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase another motorbike for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to help her open up another business, like having her own timber yard.
Her dream is to buy a plot and have a place of her own.

loan.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loan.name: Rasmeyeh

texts.en:
Rasmeyeh is a 60-year-old widowed mother from Baqa'a, Jordan.
Rasmeyeh has a grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase goods for the store.
Rasmeyeh is looking to expand her business so that she can increase her income and purchase her dream house.

loan.use: to purchase goods for the store.

loan.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has 1 child, age 25 years. In 1991, Ibrahim established his local food stuff business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy palm oil, rice and groundnut for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Ibrahim plans to educate his child to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loan.use: to buy palm oil, rice and groundnut for his business

loan.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has 2 children, ages 27 and 22 years. In 2001, Fatmata established her charcoal, wood and garri business. She began her business because her husband's salary is too low to support their home and they needed another source of income. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,400,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy bags of charcoal and wood. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. Fatmata plans to use the profits from the loan to help her husband buy a piece of land and pay school fees for their children. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: to buy bags of charcoal and wood for her business

loan.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 43-year-old woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan. She is a tailor and she is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase an additional sewing machine. Eman is looking to license her business and start making sales to companies. She wants to redecorate her home and purchase a car.

loan.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine

loan.name: Abdulqader

texts.en:
Abdulqader runs a telecommunications shop where he introduces phones services to his clients. He has been in the business for 12 years and he employs two persons. His shop is located in a crowded place with many English and Computer institutes and, because of that, almost all of his clients are students who are attracted to his business during the summer season. Recently, most of his clients (students) study in schools and universities, so Abdulqader's business faces a financial challenge leading to a decrease in his profit. As well, the current bad situation in Yemen also leads to his business being closed. So, Abdulqader took out a loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AML in order to expand his business and open it again, by buying telecommunication accessories for the return of his clients. In the future, he would like to purchase another shop for a bookshop in order to meet his clients' needs, particularly the students who are studying in the different institutes.
Abdulqader is 32 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. His educational background is Bachelor from Sana'a University.

loan.use: to expand and buy accessories to introduce customer services for his business

loan.name: You

texts.en: Mrs. You is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Prey Chor district. She has been blessed with 3 children, all of whom are still students in a local school in the province. You and her husband work together in the same rice field, earning approximately $2.50 per day, which is not enough income for the whole family. Therefore, Yous husband decided to work as a construction laborer in Thailand, a neighboring country, next month. Due to lack of capital for traveling, You is looking for some funds from HKL to support her husband by paying for his traveling fees and other expenses. In the future, You wishes to provide a good education to her children; she will encourage them to continue their schooling until grade 12 minimum.

loan.use: to support her husband by paying for his traveling fees and other expenses

loan.name: Chimedtsogzol

texts.en:
Chimedtsogzol is 51 years old and lives with her 4 children in Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. Since her husband died 5 years ago, she became the only person taking care of and earning money for the family. Her daughter is now employed and independent. Chimedtsogzol has been selling dairy products in a market regularly since 2000, both in the neighboring province and in the capital city. Since her income is not enough to support the family, she would like to increase her variety, sales and income and extend her business further.

Chimedtsogzol is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, 'I'd love to extend my business based on my 12 years of experience in order to help my family financially."' The total amount she is requesting is 1,200,000 MNT to purchase dairy products such as milk, dried curds, curds, etc. from herders,

loan.use: To purchase dairy products

loan.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea is a local farmer as is her husband. She has been in the agricultural business for many years. She lives and works in Prey Chor district, where she was born. She has six children: five are single and one is already married. One of her children now works as a garment worker in Phnom Penh city to help the family. The other children have quit studying and are unemployed. However, they always help Kea with the farm. Kea doesnt own any animals for agribusiness yet, so she wants to acquire some funds from Kiva lenders to purchase a cow. Kea hopes that shell be able to improve her business gradually.

loan.use: to purchase a cow

loan.name: Hok

texts.en:
Mr. Hok, age 39, is the father of two single children. He sells firewood, which he collects from the forest and buys in bulk from his frequent suppliers. He uses an old trailer hauled by buffaloes. He typically earns around $5.60 per day. In order to satisfy their needs, Hoks wife helps him earn income by raising some piglets in a wooden piggery at home.
Now Hok would like to borrow his first loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for household usage because he doesnt have a motorbike yet. As a result, he always walks to near distant places and takes a motor-taxi to far distant areas. For his business plan, Hok wants to expand his farming business and buy additional farming machines like a threshing machine, plowing machine, etc.

loan.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for household usage.

loan.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mr. Soun is in the business of selling firewood and lives in the Baray district. He is married with 2 children, one of whom is already married and no longer lives with the family. Besides selling firewood, Soun usually works alongside his wife to manage farming projects, especially in the rainy season.
This is Soun's first loan from HKL and Kiva. The purpose of the loan is to buy an additional buffalo to haul his firewood trailer. Soun feels very happy and thankful to the lenders who share their funds to help his family. He hopes that hell be to sustain his livelihood and improve his present business someday using the loan from Kiva.

loan.use: to buy an additional buffalo to haul his firewood trailer.

loan.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old and has 3 children. She lives in Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She owns and operates a business venture breeding and selling chickens to earn a living. She's been in this business for 11 years and earns 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from the business. She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase chicken feed.
Helen joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She simply hopes for business improvements and to repay all her debts.

loan.use: to purchase chicken feed

loan.name: Naim

texts.en: Mrs. Naim, 41, a humble farmer living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, is preparing a wedding party for her child in the next few weeks. The big day will arrive soon and Naim is worried about how to handle the party due to the lack of adequate funds. In order to better the situation, Naim is taking out her first loan from HKL to prepare a great wedding party for her second child. This loan will be the main funding to cover her expenses. In the future, Naim hopes to fix some parts of her house, especially the wall made of zinc, which currently has become decayed.

loan.use: to prepare a great wedding party for her second child.

loan.name: Thiep

texts.en: Mrs. Thiep is 66 years old and a mother of 5 children. She cultivates rice crops and raises some pigs at home. She has tried hard to provide her children with a good standard of living since her husband passed away. Some of her children also contribute some of their income to help her and to support the whole family. As shown in the picture above, her pig is out of its pigpen because the pigpen is broken and under repair. Thiep would like to ask for a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy some construction materials to rebuild her pigpen. After the pigpen is rebuilt, Thiep will buy an additional pig for breeding purposes.

loan.use: to buy construction materials to rebuild her pigpen.

loan.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem, age 23, a mother of a young kid, has been residing in Prey Chor district, where she grows rice and other crops alongside her husband. Typically, this couple is able to generate $4.00 of income per day. Nevertheless, the household expenses seem bigger than their revenues. This has the effect of making them try harder to take the family out of poverty. At present, Sems husband uses his free time to get involved in a recycling business to make extra income. He uses his old bicycle to haul a small trailer in the back to collect recycled materials from local villagers around his commune. Its difficult to go far that way. Mrs. Sem is seeking a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband's travels to collect recycled materials from farther away. Sem will save a part of the increase in income generated from the recycling business to expand her farmland and thereby increase her household income.

loan.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband's recycling business

loan.name: Sayora

texts.ru: 弌舒亶舒 亰舒仄亢亠仄 亳 仍ﾐ英舒 仄舒 仂亳 亟亠亠亶. 仆舒 仂亠仆 亟仂仍ﾐ頴湖火委 亳 亟仂弍舒 亢亠仆亳仆舒. 仂仍亠亠 6 仍亠 弌舒亶舒 亰舒仆亳仄舒亠 从仗仍亠- 仗仂亟舒亢亠亶 亞亠亠从亳 仂亠仂于. 仆舒 仗仂亟舒亠 仂于舒 仗仂 仂仗仂于仄 亠仆舒仄 亳 亳仄亠亠 仄仆仂亞仂 仗仂仂礌仆 从仍亳亠仆仂于. 仂仄亠 仂亞仂 仂仆舒 亰舒仆亳仄舒亠 仂从舒仄仍亳于舒仆亳亠仄 从仂舒. 仆舒 仂亠仍舒 弍 仗仂仍亳 亰舒亶仄 于 舒亰仄亠亠 2500 弌仂仄仂仆亳 亟仍 仗仂从仗从亳 仂于舒舒 亟仍 仗亠亠仗仂亟舒亢亳, 仂弍 舒亳亳 亳 仗仂仍亳 仂仂 仗亳弍仍.
texts.en: Sayora is married and is a loving mother of three children. She is a very hardworking and kind woman. Sayora has been involved in buying and selling walnuts for over six years. She sells products at wholesale prices and has many regular customers. Besides this, she is involved in fattening up livestock. She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2500 Somoni to purchase products for resale in order to expand and make a good profit.

loan.use: to buy walnuts

loan.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo is 39 years old, is a mother of 4 children, and lives in the Prey Chor district. Keo and her husband are in the same business, cultivating rice crops for a living. Agriculture is their sole source of income. Keo has worked in the business since 2000. She presently owns only a few pieces of farmland for growing her rice crops, and the output she produced is barely enough to meet the needs of the family. As a result, she is seeking a loan from Kiva partner HKL to buy a store of rice for daily eating during the year. In the future, she hopes that shell be able to expand her farmland and produce sufficient output for the whole family.

loan.use: to buy a store of rice for daily eating during the year.

loan.name: Uljon

texts.ru: 丕仍亢仂仆 弍仂仍亠亠 亟亠于亳 仍亠 亰舒仆亳仄舒亠 舒亰于亠亟亠仆亳亠仄 从仗仆仂仂亞舒仂亞仂 从仂舒. 仆舒 于 仂仆仂于仆仂仄 舒亰于仂亟亳 从仂 于 亟舒仍仆亠亶亠仄 亟仍 仗仂亟舒亢亳. 亶 46 仍亠. 仆舒 亰舒仄亢亠仄. 丕 仆亠亠 亠亠仂 亟亠亠亶. 仆舒 弍亠亠 从亠亟亳 亟仍 亰舒从仗舒 仆亠从仂仍从仂 亞仂仍仂于 从仗仆仂仂亞舒仂亞仂 从仂舒.
texts.en: Uljon has been involved in breeding cattle for over nine years. She primarily breeds livestock for future sale. Uljon is 46 years old, married and has six children. She is requesting this loan to purchase several heads of cattle.

loan.use: to purchase several heads of cattle

loan.name: Sayora

texts.ru: 弌舒亶舒 亟仂仍ﾐ頴湖火委 亟仂弍舒 亳 亠仍亠亠仄仍亠仆仆舒 亢亠仆亳仆舒. 仆舒 亰舒仄亢亠仄 亳 仆舒 于仂仗亳舒仆亳亳 亳仄亠亠 仂亳 亟亠亠亶. 亢 磦仍磳 舒弍仂亳仄. 仂仍亠亠 13 仍亠 仂仆舒 亰舒仆亳仄舒亠 从仗仍亠- 仗仂亟舒亢亠亶 从仂舒 仆舒 从仂仆仂仄 仆从亠. 仆舒 仂从舒仄仍亳于舒亠 亳 于 亠亠仆亳亳 3- 4 仆亠亟亠仍, 舒 亰舒亠仄 仗仂亟舒亠 亳 亰舒 于亞仂亟仆 亠仆. 弌舒亶舒 亰舒仗舒亳于舒亠 亰舒亶仄 于 舒亰仄亠亠 5000 弌仂仄仂仆亳 亟仍 仗仂从仗从亳 从仂舒 亠仍 舒亳亠仆亳 弍亳亰仆亠舒 亳 仍亠仆亳 弍仍舒亞仂仂仂礌亳亳 亠仄亳.
texts.en: Sayora is a hardworking, kind and goal-oriented woman. She is married and is raising three children. Her husband is a worker. Sayora has been involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market for over 13 years. She fattens up livestock for 3-4 weeks and then sells it at a profitable price. Sayora is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase livestock in order to expand her business and improve her family's welfare.

loan.use: to buy cattle

loan.name: Tojihol

texts.ru: 丐仂亢亳仂仍 亢亳亠仍仆亳舒 舒亶仂仆舒 丿舒亳. 亶 50 仍亠. 仆舒 亰舒仄亢亠仄. 丕 仆亠亠 亠于亠仂 亟亠亠亶. 亠 亟仂 仆舒仂亟亳 于 仂亳亳. 弌舒仄舒 丐仂亢亳仂仍 亰舒仆亳仄舒亠 从仂仂于仂亟于仂仄. 仆舒 弍仂仍亠亠 16 仍亠 舒亰于仂亟亳 从仂 于 亟舒仍仆亠亶亠仄 亟仍 仗仂亟舒亢亳. 亠亟亳 弍亠亠 亟仍 亰舒从仗舒 亠仍.
texts.en: Tojihol is a resident of the Shahrituz district. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. Her daugher is in Russia. Tojihol is involved in animal husbandry. She has been breeding livestock for future sale for over 16 years. She is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loan.use: to purchase calves

loan.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok has been operating a farming business together with her spouse in Prey Chor district. Its the only business for a low educated woman like her to earn her livelihood, she said. She is 44 years old and presently she has been blessed with 8 children, 4 of whom are living separately with their own family.
Sok grows rice both in rainy season and in dry season on a few hectares of farmland. This is her fifth loan from HKL and the first loan from Kiva. She intends to use it to build a bathroom with a toilet in it. With the remaining funds, she will use it to buy materials for farming, such as fertilizers, rice seeds and pesticides. In the future, Sok hopes to run another small micro business, pig-raising in her backyard to increase her income.

loan.use: To build a bathroom with a toilet in it.

loan.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne has operated her bookshop business in Nakuru town for the last three years. She is 24 years of age and is married.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of books and other stationery items to sell in her bookshop. This would increase her income since there is usually a high demand for books and stationeries.
In the future, Carolyne hopes to expand her business by opening other bookstores in the area as well as becoming one of the best books and stationery suppliers in Nakuru town.

loan.use: To buy more stock of books and other stationery items for sale

loan.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a resident of Litein in South Rift Kenya. She is married with 6 children who are between the ages of 26 and 11 years old, with the last five still in school. She has been in farming for 8 years and currently produces maize, milk and eggs for the local market.
Joice has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and to improve the poultry business. She says her experience with poultry farming in the business will boost her income and help her take good care for her family.
She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for faster loan processing .

loan.use: To buy poultry birds.

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 48 years old and a sole proprietor who is married with two children aged 25 and 10 years old, respectively. She has been in business for 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.
She has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy two sacks of tea leaves as well as for transportation. The profit she makes would help her educate her children. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and develop it.

loan.use: To purchase more tea leaves for sale.

loan.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has been in farming for six years, with her farm producing milk and then selling it to Kenya Co-operative Creameries. She also runs a retail business dealing with maize sold mainly to secondary schools within the local market. She is married with one child who is aged 10 years and in school.
Gladys has requested a loan of 43,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide milk for the family's daily consumption. She is optimistic the farming business will continue to grow and give her family a better living standard.
Gladys is, however, grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loan.use: to buy a dairy cow

loan.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and they all go to school. She has no additional family members.
She is a herbalist selling natural medicines. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for 10 years and she works six days a week.
She has requested for loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more natural herbs and a fridge. She generates additional income through farming. Her major challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her aspiration goal is to expand her business into a natural drug shop. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loan.use: to buy more natural medicines and a fridge

loan.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. 3 of the children are in school.
Jocelyn is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Jocelyn has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and married with 10 children.
Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells firewood in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.
Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell firewood business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.
Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loan.name: Ma. Villamor

texts.en:
Ma. Villamor is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 2 children.
Ma. Villamor has an animal or veterinary shop that sells animal feed and medications. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of animal feed and medications to sell.
Ma. Villamor has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ma. Villamor hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy stocks of animal feeds and medication to sell.

loan.name: Chrun

texts.en:
This couple are rice farmers from Prey Chor district. A woman named Chrun, is 33 years old and is the mother of one child. In general, Chrun earns approximately $1.50 per day through her business. Besides rice husbandry, Chrun takes some free time to be a poultry farmer at home.
As noticed, Chrun found that her poultry are healthy and this business will earn her a good income.
