Consequently, Chrun wants to improve this business by increasing the amount of poultry and building a cage to keep her birds protected and in good condition. On the other hand, she really needs some funds from our lenders to succeed in her business goals as mentioned.
She hopes that shell be able to provide her child a comfortable living and further education. She is very happy and appreciative of the quick response from our lenders to support her existing business.

loan.use: To buy additional poultry and build a cage to keep her birds protected and in good condition.

loan.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
Liezel has a computer shop that provides internet and online computer games. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy tools and to pay for the electricity for the services.
Liezel has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Liezel hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 53 year old barber shop owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and has been running this for the past three years with success.
This marks Christines second business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase new shaving machines and to renovate her shop.
She will use the anticipated profits to open a new business. She hopes to own many barbershops in Bamburi.

loan.use: To purchase new shaving machines and to renovate her shop.

loan.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
Gemma has a computer shop that provides Internet and online computer games. She has had this business for four years.
She requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.
Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

loan.name: Mary Trailyn

texts.en:
Mary Trailyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
Mary Trailyn has a computer shop that provides Internet and online computer games. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.
Mary Trailyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Mary Trailyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

loan.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a 61-year-old married woman in Kilifi. She is a dairy farmer and has been selling milk to her customers for the past 20 years with great success.
This is Damas second business loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to purchase more dairy cattle.
She will use the anticipated profits to build herself a residential house. She hopes to excel in the business.

loan.use: to purchase more dairy cattle.

loan.name: Agnella

texts.en:
Agnella is a 49-year-old livestock keeper in Voi. She is married and the mother of four. She has been selling livestock products for the last three years successfully.
This marks her third business loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to purchase more goats, cattle and poultry.
She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a well supported, happy family.

loan.use: to purchase more goats, cattle and poultry.

loan.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 25-year-old man from Kakamega, west Kenya. He is married to Ann and they have an eight-month-old baby.
Fredrick has operated a motorcycle and bicycle repair business for the last two years. He makes a monthly income of KES 9,700.
He is taking a first loan from KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy spare parts for his business.
He will use the anticipated profits to boost his business and expand his capital base.
His dream is to give his child the best education and also become a leading spare parts dealer in Kakamega.

loan.use: To buy motorcycle and bicycle spare parts.

loan.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 33 years old and the single mother of three children, age 16, 12 and 6 years,
She runs a business of selling second-hand clothes, a business that has existed for four years.
She has borrowed a loan of KES 50,000, with which she intends to purchase more stocks. The anticipated profit will help her repay her loan and pay school fees.
This is her second loan. Her hope for the future is to educate her children in good schools.

loan.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale.

loan.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer in Litein, age 43. He has been in active farming for 10 years with tea and milk being his main produce for the local market. He is married and has four children age 13 to 1 year. Two are in school.
Robert has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter to better feed his dairy farm animals. He says this will be a boost for dairy milk production, which will provide good income for his family's upkeep.
He aspires to grow his business and be able to reach far off markets with better prices for farming products.
He notes, however, that the markets for animal products are not fully developed, leading to low prices for farming products.

loan.use: To buy a chuff cutter.

loan.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes is a 38-year-old married mother who has been residing in Prey Chor district.
She is dedicated to a rice-cultivating business, from which she yields in the neighborhood of $1.50 per day. Her husband also helps manage the farming projects. In addition, he is engaged in animal husbandry. He buys and sells animals, especially cows, in a local market of the province.
Now Tes has requested some funds for her husband to supplement their existing capital to buy cows for trading.
With the generated income from the animal-trading business, Tes intends to cover her wall, which currently is decayed, with wooden boards.

loan.use: to buy cows for trading.

loan.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.
She operates a beauty salon from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week.
She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy braids, cosmetics and hair oils.
Her major business challenge is electricity and defaulters. Her aspiration is to build a house and also own a fully stocked salon.

loan.use: To buy more boxes of weaves, braids and hair oils

loan.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine, a 34-year-old married woman blessed with two children, has been a greenhouse farmer for the past two years, earning an income of Kshs 30,000 per month. She has requested a loan of Kshs 30,000 to purchase chemicals and a water tank, and the anticipated additional profit will help her to buy and develop a plot. Through her business, Valentine hopes to ensure her family's financial stability.

loan.use: to purchase chemicals and a water tank.

loan.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. He is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya and has been farming for three years. He operates a retail shop for additional income. His farm produce include bananas, maize, and milk which he sells at the local market.
Julius is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to buy dairy goats. Dairy goat milk has been of great use during droughts. Julius' challenges are the high costs of labor and capital. He aspires to buy more land in order to expand his bananas plantation.

loan.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loan.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 60 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a business man. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.
Jacinta is requesting her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy sugar and rice for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will help improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: to purchase sugar and rice for her shop.

loan.name: Kipngetich

texts.en:
Kipngetich, the 28-year-old father of a four-year-old, has been farming for seven years, selling his produce of milk and vegetables at the local market. Low market prices for his products are his main challenge. He gets additional income from his drawings.

Kipngetich has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow, the income from which will enable him to better maintain his family and gradually increase his number of dairy cows.

loan.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loan.name: Faraja Group

texts.en: Leonia is in her late thirties, married and has two children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by running a grocery store where she works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. and earns a good monthly profit. She is applying for her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her first three loans to buy more groceries to sell to her customers, and paid all the loans fully and on time. She hopes to use this new loan in the same way. Her goal for the future is to open a second grocery store in a different area. Leonia will share this loan with her 14-person loan group, which is called Faraja. The members of this group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loan.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a mother of 2, ages 10 and 6 years, and has been in active farming for 4 years. She runs a retail shop as well and sells her farm produce of bananas and maize to the local market.
Dinah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank. She says this will help her maintain her production and income, especially from banana farming, since she will be able to carry out farming across seasons.
She points to lack of finances as the greatest challenge to smallholder farmers.

loan.use: to purchase a water tank

loan.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old and a single mother of two. She supports her 12-year-old and 3-year-old children through her bush stone business. She has been in this business for three years and estimates her monthly income to be 20,000 KES.
She has applied for a loan worth 30,000 KES to expand her business by buying another quarry site to improve the supply of stone.
Her profit would help her repay the loan and she would save the rest. Her hopes and dreams are to enjoy her life to the fullest and educate her children.

loan.use: to buy another quarry site

loan.name: Boriya

texts.en:
Boriya is 57 years old, and lives with his wife and 2 sons in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. He has been running a shoe repair business with his wife since 1998. This has been a family business for 13 years. His 2 sons are occupational training center students.
Based on his 13 years of experience, Boriya decided to expand his business. He is an intelligent and hardworking man who says that "I am requesting this loan to renew my sewing machines so that our service would be quicker and we could earn more." The total amount he is requesting is 830,000 MNT for the fully automated sewing machines.

loan.use: to purchase fully automated sewing machines

loan.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Most Cambodian people who live in Kompong Cham prefer agribusiness to other businesses because the area contains fertile soil, productive land and the farmers always keep it fertile by growing cover and adding manure. Mrs. Chuon, age 42, as well as other local villagers have been in the rice-cultivating business for ages. Moreover, she devotes her spare time to raise some pigs at home. She divorced her husband and lives with 2 single children attending a local school.
Chuon is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase more piglets and pig feed to stabilize her business and improve it as much as she can. Her business goal is to own a medium farm, on which many pigs are bred.

loan.use: to purchase more piglets and pig feeds to stabilize her business and improve it as much as she can

loan.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in the southern part of Mongolia. Her husband is employed. Her elder daughter studies in the first grade of school and her other two daughters are kindergarten students.
Erdenechimeg has been running a food cart service since 2008. She usually comes to the train station to sell food to the passengers. But, to keep the food fresh, she needs to have a big refrigerator for the supplies for her business. She is an intelligent woman who says that "I would like to buy a big refrigerator for the supplies so that they can stay fresh and my sales and income will increase." The total amount she is requesting is 500,000 MNT to purchase a refrigerator and television for her home.

loan.use: to purchase a refrigerator and television for her home.

loan.name: Policronio

texts.en:
Policronio is a 47-year-old married man with five children between the ages of 7 and 21. His wife works as a cook in an eatery.
Policronio runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business in Trinidad, Bohol. He earns about 6,000 PHP per month with his business. Policronio works hard to sustain his family, especially to pay for his children's education. He said he wants all of them to finish college and be successful.
Policronio has requested this loan to purchase spare motorcycle parts and to pay for his children's school fees. Policronio hopes to expand his business in the future.

loan.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts and to pay for his children's school fees.

loan.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 42, married and has two children who are 22 and 18 years old. For the last 12 years, he has earned a living by farming and raising cows which produce milk that he sells to people who live in his area. He employs one farmhand and supplements his income by doing carpentry work. He has applied for a loan for 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to build a modern dairy unit in his farm. This will help him increase his income, buy more cows and cope with a recent spell of poor weather.

loan.use: to build a modern dairy.

loan.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man. He has two daughters and two sons. He describes himself to be honest, competent, and God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells jewelery. He has been involved in this business for five months. His business is located at a viable place. He will use the 5,000 KES loan to buy vegetables and fruits to start a new business of a grocery store. Julius's business goal is to run a well-stocked grocery store within five years.

loan.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to start a new business

loan.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is 40 years old, married, and has three children (ages 12, 10 and 8). His wife works as a pharmacist.
Enrique is a gasoline retailer. He has had this business for three years. Enrique works hard to support his family. He requested this loan to buy more oil and gasoline to sell. Enrique hopes to expand his business in the future.

loan.use: to buy more oil and gasoline to sell

loan.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeu is in three businesses: rice husbandry, pig-raising and the rice trading business, whereas her husband is a rice farmer as well as a fisherman. She has five children, three of whom live together in Pouk district, while the other two are working as laborers in a neighbor country.
With the sum of $1,000, Oeu will buy two head of buffalo for her farming project. For her future prospects, she wishes to expand her rice-selling store to attract more clients to buy her rice produce.

loan.use: to buy two head of buffalo for her farming project.

loan.name: Glicerio

texts.en:
Glicerio is a married man with three children aged 11, 5 and 2. He works as a farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. Glicerio primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 5000 Php per month doing this farming.
Glicerio works hard to improve his business and save for his children's education. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy damasks and "pagnes Wax" (colorful African cloth)

loan.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school. She has one additional family member (mother).
Angel sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes.
Her major business challenges are seasonality, defaulters, and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees. Her aspiration is to build a house and to start selling at wholesale only.

loan.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loan.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 25 years old and married to Vionah. They are not yet blessed with children. He does livestock farming in the Chepkunyuk location and has been in operation for a period of two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.
He is taking a first term loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase a cow for the farm. The investment returns will be used to purchase a family plot of land and to pay back the loan.
He dreams of being financially stable.

loan.use: to purchase one dairy cow.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy some pagnes.

loan.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has two additional family members (her late sisters children).
She sells local brew (local gin) on a retail basis from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for six years. She works seven days a week.
She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin and glasses. Milly generates additional income through selling tomatoes and onions. Her major business challenges are transportation, defaulters, and thieves.
Her aspirations and goals are to own a fully stocked pub and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loan.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin and glasses.

loan.name: Herina

texts.en:
Herina is a 41-year-old lady from Siaya County, Western Kenya. She is married to George and they have three children aged between 8 to 14 years.
Herina has run a hotel (restaurant) business in Siaya town for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of KES 12,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy foodstuffs like sugar, cooking fat, and rice. She will channel her profits to provide basic needs for her family.
Her dream is to grow her business so that she will be able to meet her family's needs.

loan.use: to buy foodstuffs for the hotel, like sugar, cooking fat, and rice.

loan.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a single woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 to 16 years. She describes herself to be diligent, honest, and trustworthy.
She operates a salon where she provides hair dressing. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a competitive area and her customers are both new and repeat customers. She will use the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan to buy more beauty products. Anita's hope and dream within the next five years is to run two extra beauty salons.

loan.use: To buy more beauty products for her salon.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy onions, bouillon cubes, pepper, tomato paste, and table salt

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loan.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children all of whom go to school. She doesnt take care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.
Sylvia sells sweet bananas at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of sweet bananas. Her major business challenges are thieving during transport and defaulters. Her aspirations and goals are to expand her business into wholesale.

loan.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loan.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 40 years old, single, and has two children. She has been selling cereals for six years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.
Violet is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loan.use: to purchase dry maize and beans.

loan.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a married man with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past 21 years, he has operated a retail shop, selling household products to his neighbors. He also owns livestock and sells milk as another source of income. Katana dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.
With the KES 50,000 he wants to pay school fees and purchase textbooks for his child. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: to pay school fees and purchase textbooks for his child.

loan.name: Mawata

texts.en:
Mawatta is 26 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children who are 2 and 6 years old. Their children live at home and one attends school.
For the past five years, Mawatta has been selling fashion clothes. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business. Her plans is to become an international businesswoman.

loan.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loan.name: Pauson

texts.en:
Pauson is a 63-year-old farmer from the district of Kyenjojo in Uganda. He wants a loan to clear land and also to buy cattle.
A father of 12 children, Pauson dreams of educating all his children and building a permanent residential house. He started as a subsistence farmer, but now he is a commercial farmer.

loan.use: to clear land and also to buy cattle.

loan.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 25 years old and a mother of one child. She sells used clothes and has been in the business for the last five years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000, with which she intends to purchase trousers, blouses, skirts, and bed sheets to resell. Beth will save the anticipated profits so that she may assist in educating her child, while also expanding her business.
In the future, Beth hopes to own her own boutique and hopes to earn more money from it with the intention of becoming financially stable.

loan.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, skirts, and bed sheets.

loan.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is 33 years old and married. He lives in a permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has a banana plantation, which he has cultivated for five years.
Silver is requesting a loan, which he will use to rehabilitate his banana plantation. His major challenge is the banana wilt disease, which has destroyed almost half of his plantation. He dreams of building a permanent residential house and owning more plantations.

loan.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation..

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy 15 pieces of "pagnes Wax" (colorful African cloth)

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to prepare land for next season

loan.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a single man who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past year he has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to caf辿 operators and restaurant operators. He faces major challenges in the high cost of transportation and in competition. Amani dreams of establishing a big poultry farm in the future.
With the 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) he wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy 20 pieces of rich damask

loan.name: Nuliat

texts.en: Nuliat is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For seven years she has been operating a retail shop and this has enabled her to support her family. She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale shop and sustain her family. Nuliat wants a loan to buy sugar for resale.

loan.use: to buy sugar for reselling

loan.name: Mumbo

texts.en: Mumbo is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to expand his meat goat business. With the loan, he wants to purchase goats and establish a butcher shop to sell meat. Since the first Kiva loan, his business has improved greatly, and he dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of goat meat in the area.

loan.use: to purchase goats and establish a butcher shop to sell meat.

loan.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 50 years old and is a farmer from Pouk district. She grows various kinds of vegetable leaves, which are used for food. Mao plants her vegetables near a pond, which provides the main source of water for the vegetables. From her business, Mao is able to earn an average of $2.26 per day.
Mao is requesting her first loan from HKL, which she will use to purchase a used motorbike for use by her whole family as well as two sacks of fertilizer. She hopes that she will be able to expand her business someday.

loan.use: to purchase a used motorbike.

loan.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child and she goes to school. She doesnt have additional family members.
Evelyn is a tailor at the market; she sells on retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for the last 15 years, working six days a week. She has requested for loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing materials and threads.
Evelyn's major business challenges are transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to build commercial houses and also to own a tailoring school. She lives in her own house. Her family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loan.use: to buy more clothing materials and threads.

loan.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another Kiva loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to improve her charcoal selling business. With this loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. Since her first Kiva loan, her monthly income has increased by 50 percent. Fatuma dreams of purchasing a pick-up van to be used for supplying charcoal in the future.

loan.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loan.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is acquiring a loan to buy timber for furniture making. He is a 43-year-old man living in Masindi-Uganda. He is a carpenter and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his wife and four children. Price fluctuations, inflation, and creditors hinder his business.
Baker dreams of educating his children and saving for a wedding.

loan.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loan.name: Ayesiza

texts.en:
Ayesiza is 32 years old and married with children living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a produce business that she has been running for 1 year. She started it with a small capital given to her by her husband. She faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand.
Ayesiza's family goal is to build a permanent house and her business goal is to move her business to a permanent location. Ayesiza needs the loan to buy produce to sell.

loan.use: to buy produce to sell.

loan.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a 49-year-old boda boda (motorcycle) owner in Mombasa. She is married. She has an employee who ferries people using the motorcycle. She has been doing this business for the past five years.
This marks her fourth business loan from KADET LTD, with which she plans to service her motorcycle. She will use the anticipated profits to buy an additional motorcycle. She hopes to have an established transportation business.

loan.use: to service her motorcycle.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy seedlings and pay for labor.

loan.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She has one additional dependent. She lives in Kampala, Uganda where she sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years and works six days a week.
Milly is requesting for loan for 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenges are increasing prices of charcoal and seasonality. Her goal is to educate her children to university level.
Milly lives in her own house with access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loan.use: to purchase bags of charcoal.

loan.name: Pav

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Mrs. Pav, age 48, cultivates both rainy-season rice and dry-season rice for her living. She usually earns around $2.50 per day to cover her daily expenses. She is a responsible mother of five children, two of whom are already married and live independently.
At the present time, some parts of Pavs house are broken like her thatched wall and planks. So she would like to seek some funds from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase some building materials to fix her house. In the future, she plans to buy a few additional plots of land to increase her rice output among the year.

loan.use: to purchase some building materials to fix her house.

loan.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man with two children, one of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past three years, he has operated a motorcycle business, operating from home to the market whereby his neighbours are the potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate his business. Emmanuel dreams of establishing a retail shop for his wife to operate.
With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to pay school fees for his child who attends school. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loan.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik is 29 years old and married with three children. For over ten years, Malik has owned an art and design business where he designs T-shirts. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital to supply the vast market.
His family goal is to educate his children and he hopes in future to buy land for crop growing. He intends to use the loan to buy T-shirts and chemicals.

loan.use: to purchase T-shirts and chemicals for his art shop.

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (her sister). She operates a retail shop. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, maize flour, beans, rice, and jerrycans of cooking oil.
Sarah generates additional income through tailoring. Her major challenges are transportation and electricity. Her aspirations and goals are to expand her retail business into a wholesale shop. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more bags of sugar, maize flour, beans, rice and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loan.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna owns a retail shop which she has been running for over ten years. Her business has been very profitable and she has used the profits to start constructing rental houses.
Maimuna faces the challenge of inadequate capital to supply her increasing number of customers. Her goals are to educate her children and to own a wholesale shop and an estate. Maimuna needs this loan to complete building her rental houses.

loan.use: to complete her rental houses.

loan.name: Sando

texts.en: Sando is 22 years old and lives in Gardnersville. Shes married to a businessman and the couple has two children, 1 and 5 years old. The children live at home and one attends school. For the past two years, Sando has been selling charcoal. She was taught how to run the business by her oldest sister. Sando is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build her own house.

loan.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loan.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mr. Chhun is a 53-year-old widower. He lives with his 7 children in Kompong Cham province, where he has devoted his lifetime to rice farming. Through his business, he generates approximately $2.50 per day and tries hard to support his family. Four of his children work in various careers and share some of their income to satisfy the familys needs. However, his two sons who are construction workers are experiencing difficulties in traveling to their workplace without a family-owned motorcycle. To solve this problem, Chhun decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a secondhand motorbike for his sons to commute to work without using any taxi services. Chhun is very happy and thankful for the loan given to him to improve his living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase a secondhand motorbike for his sons to commute to work.

loan.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a hardworking married woman living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. She is a banana farmer who started out by harvesting 3 bunches of bananas and who can now harvest 80 bunches quarterly. Despite the fact that Violet has progressed in her farming, she faces the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation and banana bacterial wilt. Her dream is to educate her children, to build a permanent house and to buy land to grow crops. Violet needs this loan to rehabilitate her banana plantation.

loan.use: to rehabilitate her banana plantation

loan.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She doesnt take care of additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for over five years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.
Berna's major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to expand into wholesale business and also to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loan.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loan.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of low demand for clothes during the rainy season. She dreams of establishing a stall to sell her clothes in the future.
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loan.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and all of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member, her father. She has a food stall selling tomatoes, onions, cabbages, Irish potatoes, and bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.
She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, baskets of onions and tomatoes, and Irish potatoes. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to get a bigger room where she can sell her food stuffs from. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loan.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, baskets of onions and tomatoes, and Irish potatoes

loan.name: Akyljan

texts.ru: 从仍亢舒仆 49 仍亠, 于亟仂于舒, 亳仄亠亠 亠 亟亠亠亶, 仄仍舒亟舒 亳亰 从仂仂 从仂仍仆亳舒. 2002 亞仂亟, 于 仗仂亳从舒 亳仂仆亳从舒 亟仂仂亟舒 亟仍 于仂亠亶 亠仄亳, 从仍亢舒仆 仆舒舒仍舒 于仂亶 弍亳亰仆亠 于 亢亳于仂仆仂于仂亟于亠 仂 舒仂于仂亶 仄仄 于 40,000 仂仄 (KGS). 仍舒亞仂亟舒 仗仂于 亳 仆舒仂亶亳于仂亳, 仆舒 亠亞仂亟仆仆亳亶 亟亠仆, 亠亠 仂亰磺于仂 仗亳仆仂亳 仂从仂仍仂 10,000 仂仄 (KGS) 于 仄亠 仂 仗仂亟舒亢亳 仄仂仍仂仆 亳 仄仆 仗仂亟从仂于. 亠仍 亟舒仍仆亠亶亠亞仂 舒亰于亳亳 于仂亠亞仂 弍亳亰仆亠舒, 从仍亢舒仆 仂弍舒亳仍舒 于 从仂仄仗舒仆亳 束舒亶-丐仄 亳 舒仆亠損 亰舒 从亠亟亳仂仄 于 仄仄亠 80,000 仂仄 (KGS) 仆舒 仗仂从仗从 亟仂仗仂仍仆亳亠仍仆 亞仂仍仂于 从仂舒. 仂仂亟 仂 仂亰磺于舒 从仍亢舒仆 仗仍舒仆亳亠 于仍仂亢亳 于 仂仗仍舒 于亠亞仂 仂弍舒亰仂于舒仆亳 亟仍 于仂亠亶 亟仂亠亳.
texts.en: Akyljan is a 49-year-old widow and has three children. Her youngest daughter is still a schoolgirl. In 2002, in search of a source of income for her family, Akyljan started her own animal husbandry business with a starting sum of 40,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tenacity and perseverance, her farming business now brings about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of meat and dairy products. In order to further expand her business, Akyljan has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to purchase additional head of cattle. She plans to use her revenues to pay for her daughter's higher education.

loan.use: to purchase cattle.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more textbooks, exercise books, geometrical sets, and printing papers.

loan.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, aged 18, 17, 14 and four years respectively. For the past three years, she has had a scrap business, which earns her a monthly income of KES 15,000. She wants to buy more scrap materials and pay her children's school fees, so she has requested a loan of KES 30,000.
The anticipated profits will assist her in paying the school fees for her children. Her dream is to buy a plot and open up a big wholesale business.

loan.use: to buy more scrap materials and pay her children's school fees.

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (father). She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years, and she works seven days a week.
Joyce has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more utensils, rice, bunches of bananas, and beef. Her major business challenges are transportation and defaulters. Her aspirations and goals are to install piped water in her home and to own a fully stocked restaurant. She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loan.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, utensils, beef and rice.

loan.name: John

texts.en: John is a 34-year-old man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a carpenter for the last two years and his major hardships are price fluctuation and inflation. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to other areas. John needs a loan to buy timber for making furniture.

loan.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loan.name: Fatmata B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Like their colleague teachers from other schools, they have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, these borrowers will be able to tackle some financial difficulties that their mere salaries alone cannot solve. At the end of each month, each of them repays SMT/Kiva lenders using their monthly salaries. Their schools bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayments on their behalf.
Fatmata is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Makeni city, the 32-year-old is married to a businessman and the couple has two children who are attending primary schools. Fatmata has been serving in the teaching profession for 11 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials for the construction of a family house.

loan.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a family house

loan.name: Hannan

texts.en:
Hannan is a 23-year-old woman who never finished high school but is determined to create a better future. She learned to raise animals and has now opened a business raising sheep. She buys baby ewes, raises healthy sheep and resells them at a good profit.
She took this loan to purchase additional sheep and ewes.
Hannan wants to see her business activity expand and eventually begin selling meat.

loan.use: To purchase additional sheep and ewes

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary wants a loan to buy chicken feed. She is a widow aged 51 years and lives in Masindi, Uganda. Mary is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her three children. She started with 10 chicks seven years ago, but now has 300 birds. Her desire is to educate her children and her dream is to diversify her business and buy land to grow crops.

loan.use: to buy chicken feed

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding her business.
With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to pay for school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to pay for school fees

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of one daughter aged 8 years old. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the last three years. Her monthly income is Kshs 12,000.
Susan has requested for a Kshs 20,000 loan, which she will be using to buy more stock of clothes. The profit she gets from her business will be used to educate her daughter. Her dream is to own her own bale shop.

loan.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loan.name: Sumaiya

texts.en: Sumaiya wants a loan to buy new clothes for resale. She is a 28-year-old woman living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on her, and her dream is to own a boutique and educate her children.

loan.use: to buy new clothes for resale.

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She operates a chemist (pharmacy) in Mpeketoni, Lamu town. She has been in the business for the last three years, with a monthly income of KES 60,000.
She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan, in the amount of KES 80,000, from the company. She will use the loan to expand her business by stocking it with antibiotics, painkillers, syringes, energy boosters such as Lucozade, and other products needed in the business.
Beatrice will save the anticipated profit to help take care of her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and venture into other investments.

loan.use: to add stocks of antibiotics, painkillers, syringes, and energy boosters such as Lucozade.

loan.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 41-year-old widow from southern Israel. She raises sheep and sells the milk and labane cheese she produces.
Miriam needs this loan to purchase additional sheep to meet production demands.
Miriam wants to continue and see her business strengthen and expand. She strives one day to build homes for her children.

loan.use: To purchase additional sheep to meet production demands

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to hire tractors for digging.

loan.name: Azarious

texts.en: Azarious is a married man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and to build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for the last thirty years, and his major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase equipment. However, he has a vision of diversifying his farm and expanding it to new areas. Azarious needs the requested loan to buy seeds for planting.

loan.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loan.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past five years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak, leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed

loan.name: Kesiah

texts.en:
Kesiah is 67 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for over ten years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of 15,000 KES. She plans to use the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds.
She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her family's needs. In the future, Kesiah hopes to grow her farm into mixed farming.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past three years, Julia has operated a clothing sales business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Julia's major challenge is delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
Julia plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a 56-year-old businessman, is married to Jane, a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 20 and 18. Peter has been in the motorcycle transport business for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.
Peter is applying for his first loan term after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. Peter plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and to build rental houses.

loan.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike

loan.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a widowed woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Nzadze's greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past four years, Nzadze has operated a grocery business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is price fluctuation of goods in the market. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.
Nzadze plans to use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loan.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a 34-year-old man from Kakamega County, situated in Western Kenya. He is married to Caroline and they have three children aged between 7 and 16 years old.
Caleb has operated a welding business in Kakamega for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of KES 9,550. He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy metal and other materials for his workshop.
Caleb plans to reinvest any profits he will make back into his business. His dream is to start taking large scale tenders from schools and colleges for items such as desks and chairs.

loan.use: To buy metal for his welding business.

loan.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 44-year-old businesswoman and a single mother of two children. She has been selling cereals for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family.
Janet is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. She will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. Janet plans to use the anticipated profit from her business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loan.use: To buy dry maize and beans for sale

loan.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: 舒亳仆舒 亢亳亠仍仆亳舒 亞仂仂亟舒 舒. 亶 44 亞仂亟舒. 仆舒 亰舒仄亢亠仄. 丕 仆亠亠 仂亠 亟亠亠亶. 亠 仄亢 舒弍仂舒亠 于 仂亳亶从仂亶 个亠亟亠舒亳亳. 弌舒仄舒 仂仆舒 亳仄亠亠 亠亟仆亠 仗亠亳舒仍仆仂亠 仂弍舒亰仂于舒仆亳亠, 仂仄舒仂仍仂亞. 舒 亠亞仂亟仆仆亳亶 亟亠仆 舒亳仆舒 亰舒仆亳仄舒亠 亳亰亞仂仂于仍亠仆亳亠仄 亳 舒仆仂于从仂亶 亰弍仆 仗仂亠亰仂于 亳 亰弍仆 从仂仂仆仂从. 仂亶 仂弍仍舒亳 仂仆舒 舒弍仂舒亠 20 仍亠. 亠亟亳 弍亠亠 亟仍 仗亳仂弍亠亠仆亳 舒仗仗舒舒舒 亟仍 亳亰亞仂仂于仍亠仆亳 亰弍仆 仗仂亠亰仂于 亳 从仂仂仆仂从 亳亰 仄亠舒仍仍仂从亠舒仄亳从亳.
texts.en: Zarrina is a resident of the city of Isfara. She is 44 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation. Zarrina has a secondary-specialized education as a dentist. Today, Zarrina is involved in manufacturing and installing teeth prosthetics and crowns. She has been in this business for 20 years. She is requesting this loan to purchase equipment for making prosthetics and crowns from metal-ceramics.

loan.use: to purchase equipment for making prosthetics and crowns from metal-ceramics

loan.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while the fifth has already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past three years, Masika has operated a retail shop business, selling to town dwellers and passersby. Her major business challenge is delayed payments by creditors. Masika dreams of expanding her business to meet customer demand.
Masika plans to use this KES 25,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loan.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 29, and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Azelo, an overseas contract worker, and has two children. The entire family manages their own household while operating the business. Victoria works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.
Victoria retails processed meat products, such as hotdogs, sweetened pork, etc. She gets her products from the wholesaler and sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Victoria earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.
To help her continue business operations, Victoria is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in business income as she expands the business.
Victoria hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to buy additional stock of processed meat

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has two children. Josephine is a food vendor; a business she started three years with her savings. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to purchase foodstuffs for the kiosk.
The main challenges Josephine faces are the customers not paying on time and the high inflation. Despite all this, she looks forward to opening a hotel. The extra income from the loan will help educate Josephines children.

loan.use: To purchase foodstuffs for the kiosk.

loan.name: Celodinia

texts.en:
This is Celodina, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She and her husband Uldanicoo, a driver, have children. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Celodina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil or an egg. Celodina buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 9000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Celodina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to pay for grocery items and products to sell at her variety store.

loan.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, 64, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She and her husband Marcial, a mason, have children. With her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Carmen operates a doormat business. Her products are small rugs and larger doormats. She makes doormats out of excess textile cloth she buys from the factory. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that can be boughtsometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding vehicle down the highway! She sells her products directly to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Carmen hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to buy textile cloth for making rugs and doormats.

loan.name: Bint Ndawa

texts.en:
Bint Ndawa is a married woman with nine children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past ten years, she has operated a mat-weaving business, selling from door-to-door to town dwellers and neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bamboo slivers as materials for weaving mats. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bamboo slivers as materials for weaving mats.

loan.name: Banaz

texts.en:
Banaz is a 33-year-old married woman from Iraq and she is a mother of two children. For 14 years she has been helping to support her family, working from home on a sewing machine, taking great pride in her work. She happily shows her work station, which is a neat little corner in a sunlit room of her home.
In the past Banaz took a loan from Relief International - Iraq to create a work area for herself in her home, making it easier and more comfortable for her to work on her sewing and tailoring orders. After successfully repaying the previous loan, Banaz has now taken out a loan from RI-Iraq in the amount of 1800 USD, which she plans to use for purchasing a new machine, an overlock sewing machine, and some more fabric and raw materials to continue serving her customers' needs.

loan.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and raw materials.

loan.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie, 51, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband Melchor is a plumber and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Julie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
Julie hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
This is Ofelia, 56, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow with two children. Together with her children, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Ofelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
Ofelia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Zillia

texts.en:
Zillia is 23 years old and a mother of one child. She sells fruits and vegetables and has been in the business for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 8,000.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from the company, with which she intends to add additional stock of mangoes, pineapples, kale and other vegetables for sale.
The client will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her child. In the future, Zillia hopes to grow her business and also venture into other investments.

loan.use: to add stock of mangoes, pineapples, kale, and other vegetables for sale.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 33 years old. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years, and earns extra income from his farming activities. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joseph has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorcycle.

loan.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loan.name: Ivlita

texts.en:
Ivlita is from the village Napareuli, Kakheti Region. She is 43 years old and lives with her family, husband Archil, and 22-year-old son. Archil works as a night watchman and their son is unemployed.
According to Credos estimations Ivlitas family belongs to the group of rural subsistence poor. The monthly income of the family is on average 500 Laris. Ivlita cultivates a family-owned plot of the land, where tomatoes and maize are grown. Harvested products are mainly consumed by the family, though some surplus is sold on the local market.
Ivlita received the loan in the framework of a start-up program. She will start a new family business with the loan. She plans to purchase calves. After 12 14 month the calves will turn into milk cows. Ivlita will start cheese production. She will sell the cheese on the local market. It will significantly increase the income of the family. Ivlita will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve the family living conditions. Also part of the additional profit will be reinvested in dairy farming, in order to improve it and increase its profitability.

loan.use: to purchase calves

loan.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with nine children, three of whom attend school while the others have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past five years, she has operated a mat and basket-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding her business so she can meet her customers' demands.
With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase bamboo slivers to weave baskets and mats to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bamboo slivers to weave baskets and mats to sell.

loan.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with eight children, three of whom attend school while five have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past ten years, she has operated a business selling groceries at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of market price fluctuations. Mwaka dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old, married and a mother of three children. She runs a small cafe and has been in the business for the last six years earning a monthly profit of KES 10,000.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000 from the company. She will use the loan to purchase additional stocks of cooking oil, wheat flour, plates, cups, spoons for her cafe.
She will save the anticipated profit and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Agnes hopes to grow her business and turn it into a well established hotel.

loan.use: to buy stocks of cooking oil, wheat flour, plates, cups and spoons.

loan.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with two children, neither of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past year, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the perishability of products leading to incurring losses. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loan.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, and all her children go to school. She doesnt take care of any additional family members. She sells secondhand shoes at the market at both retail and wholesale prices. She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works six days a week.
She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand shoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to build commercial houses and start selling wholesale only. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more bales of secondhand shoes.

loan.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 35 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She sells used clothes and has been in the business for the last five years, with a monthly income of about KES 35,000.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from the company, with which she intends to purchase skirts, trousers, blouses and bed sheets.
She will save the anticipated profit so that she may assist in educating her children while also growing her business in the process. In future, Hellen hopes to own her own boutique and to earn more money with the intention of becoming financially stable.

loan.use: to purchase skirts, trousers, blouses and bed sheets.

loan.name: Sherina

texts.en:
Sherina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child and she goes to school. She doesnt take care of additional family members. She sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week.
She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loan.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of an additional family member, her father. She sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week.
She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a plot of land and also to start selling on a wholesale basis only. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to piped water but does not have access to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loan.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loan.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 31-year-old, married father of three children who lives in Taiz,Yemen. He only completed secondary school then became interested in a hydraulic spare parts shop which has been running for six years. It is the only main source of income of the family. He has worked very hard to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve.
He started his business by working as a car mechanic in small workshop but that was not enough to cover his family expenses so he was forced to sell his house in the village in order to start up this business and improve his living conditions. He has attracted more customers because his business is located in a strategic area and because of the strength of mind which he has enjoyed.
Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took out a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to supply his business with more products and keep his customers coming back.
In the future, he would like expand his business such as by purchasing another shop and making it a car spare parts shop as well as purchasing a truck..

loan.use: to supply his customers' demand and keep them coming back to his business.

loan.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with eleven children, four of whom attend school while others graduated from school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past one year, he has operated a "boda boda" (motorcycle) transport business, operating from home to the market whereby neighbours are his potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.
With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle which broke down. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle which broke down.

loan.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children, two girls and three boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for the food stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for the food stall business.

loan.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Mwanaisha dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.
With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loan.name: Beata

texts.en:
Beata is single and has three children. Living in deteriorated housing, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to improve her house by purchasing building materials to change her weakened zinc roof and broken wooden walls as well as a new door and window.
Beata is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost five years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Trabajando para el ma単ana (Working for the future) in one of the rural villages in Samana, where she has received six loans to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products,
Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure, while running their businesses loans and attending groups meetings.

loan.use: to purchase zinc, wood, nails, and other construction materials.

loan.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El se単or Anastacio es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha dedicado en ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace 2 a単os el inicio como chofer de taxi en una tienda comercial de la ciudad, ofreciendo el servicio hasta sus casas a un bajo precio.
Hace pocos d鱈as les solicitaron que pintaran los taxis de acuerdo a la empresa para la que est叩n asociados, ten鱈an que llevar los colores logotipos ya que es una manera de prevenci坦n para detectar a los taxis que son piratas.
Pero Anastacio no cuenta con el dinero por tal motivo solicita de su apoyo para comprar la pintura y mano de obra. De esta manera no tendr叩 que suspender sus labores.
texts.en:
Anastacio is a very hardworking man who always has worked offering his family a better quality of life. Two years ago he began as a taxi driver in a commercial store in the city, offering service home at a low price.
A few days ago they asked them to paint the taxis in accordance with the business with which they are associated. The taxis had to be the colors of the logo because it is a preventive way to detect pirate taxis.
But Anastacio does not have the money. For this reason he is requesting your support to buy the paint and labor, so he will not have to suspend his work.

loan.use: to buy paint and pay for labor for his taxi.

loan.name: Jogie

texts.en:
Jogie, is married and has three children. Jogie is 50 years old and resides at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines.
Jogie raises pigs for sale to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this business.
She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.
In 2011, Jogie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Jogie wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loan.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.
Ma. Cecilia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.
She has been in this business for five years.
In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy products to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, bread, and other items.

loan.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. Arlyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.
Arlyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets for her business.
Arlyn has been in this business for six years now.
In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: To purchase fishing nets for her business.

loan.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old, married and has two children.
Liza is in the agricultural business with a livestock retail business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.
Liza has been in the livestock retail business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loan.use: To buy additional livestock to sell.

loan.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 45-year-old married woman with two children aged 16 and 7. Vilma's husband works as a farmer.
Vilma is also a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for twelve years. Vilma works hard to support her family and send her children to school. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and certified seeds. Vilma hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and certified seeds.
