loan.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim, 61, is in the business of selling vegetables, which she grows herself. She also buys in bulk from her suppliers. In general, she makes an average of $5.00 per day from the business. When it comes to planting vegetables, Sims husband is the main laborer, and manages all the works, however, Sim also works alongside her husband. Sim has been blessed with one child who always assists in the family-owned business when he has free time from his business which is providing a motor-taxi service.
With the loan of $800, Sim intends to expand her business by buying more vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers. She will use the remaining funds to fix the broken parts of her present house. Her future goal is to advance her farming and selling business.

loan.use: to buy more vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loan.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 63 years old, married, and has two adult children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Zenaida primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also sells dressed chickens in her community. Zenaida has a monthly income of 5,000 PHP.
Zenaida is requesting aloan to buy farm fertilizers and more chickens to sell. She hopes to increase her earnings and expand her businesses.

loan.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and more chickens to sell.

loan.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie is a 25-year-old married woman with two young children. Her husband works as a fisherman.
Jeramie is also engaged in fishing. She sells her husband's catch at the market. She also buys from other fishermen to have more fish to sell. Jeramie also buys crabs to sell. She works hard to support her family and save for her children's education.
Jeramie has requested this loan to buy fishing nets and more crabs to sell. In the future, Jeramie hopes to have better living conditions. She also hopes to send her children to school.

loan.use: to buy fishing nets and more crabs to sell.

loan.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children. She is a food vendor. Alma sells fried peanuts, banana cues (deep fried bananas) and cassava rolls to her community. Alma earns about PHP 2,500 per month doing this business.
Alma has requested this loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, bananas, cassava and sugar. Alma hopes this loan will help improve her business.

loan.use: to buy ingredients such as peanuts, bananas, cassava and sugar.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy stocks of coffee to sustain her husbands business and constant sales.

loan.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the group called Trabajando para el futuro (Working for the future), located in the city of Samana. This is her 14th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for over seven years, starting when she took her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. Since then she has paid back all her loans and expanded her business.
After her last loan, which she invested in her business, Isabel realised the need to improve her home by building a decent kitchen as the one she has is very weak and not safe. This is the reason why she talked to other members of her group and they recommended her for a Housing loan to improve her home kitchen.
Esperanza Internacional runs a programme for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.
Isabel is the mother of five children. Two of them live with her and her husband in their simple rural home. Isabel will use this loan to buy wood, zinc, nails, cement and other construction materials. With these, she will build a kitchen for her house, including the doors, walls, floor and a zinc roof.
Isabel thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family she thanks all of you for your support!
In the picture we can see Isabel next to her old kitchen.

loan.use: to buy wood, zinc, nails and other construction materials.

loan.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past five years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future.
With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and green vegetables.

loan.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs.Yorn, age 32, is a local farmer who has been living in Kompong Cham province. She is married with four school-aged children, all of whom are under her income. Her husband is in the same business, cultivating rice crops on a few hectares of farmland. This couple has been involved in this business since 2000, with a lot of experience. Together, they typically earn in the neighborhood of $5.50 per day to cover daily expenses.
Yorn will use the amount she has requested from HKL to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local villagers and then she will act as a middleman to sell out her product at a profitable price. Yorn hopes that she will be able to strengthen and improve her present business.

loan.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local villagers.

loan.name: Mwamali

texts.en:
Mwamali is applying for another loan to start a new food stall business. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business. In the future, Mwamali aspires to continue improving her businesses.
Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwamali has greatly improved her familys standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loan.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil

loan.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is 52 years old, married and lives in the Philippines with her husband and one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by providing transportation services to people who live in her community. She earns about PHP 10,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 to repair the vehicle that she uses to transport her passengers. Last year, Adelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and life. In the future, she hopes to provide a better standard of living to her family.

loan.use: to repair a vehicle used in a transportation business.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been a tailor for the past two years earning a monthly income of 7,800 KES, which she uses to support her family.
Elizabeth is requesting for her first loan from KADET, which she will use to buy clothe materials. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her dream is to open a boutique shop.

loan.use: to purchase clothe for making dresses.

loan.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old and married with 4 children. With 3 children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.
Gina runs a sari sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.
Gina has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, egg, spices, bread, etc.
In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loan.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
Rosa has a poultry farm and a shop that sells mature chickens and eggs. She has operated this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP in order to buy feed for the chickens.
Rosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy feed for the chickens.

loan.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children.
Mercedes provides the motorcycle with a sidecar where she has a hired driver for her motorcycle. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.
Mercedes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercedes hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services

loan.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 53-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has no children yet and hopes to have one soon.
Carmelita has had a sari-sari store business for a year. She sells items like soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap and spices. Carmelita earns 4,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks.
In the future, Carmelita hopes for her business to grow.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks

loan.name: Cristina

texts.en:
60-year-old Cristina is a married woman with two children aged 26 and 22. Her husband works as a fisherman.
Cristina has had a sari-sari store business for more than 10 years. She sells various items like soft drinks and canned goods. Cristina earns 3,500 PHP per month with her sari-sari store. Cristina also helps her husband sell fish to their community. Cristina works hard to support her family.
Cristina plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets and traps and more items to sell at her store. In the future, Cristina hopes

loan.use: to buy fishing nets and traps for her husband and more items to sell at her store

loan.name: Benedictor

texts.en: Benedictor is a 38-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 11 years old. He describes himself to be focused and principled. He operates a retail business where he sells sand, charcoal and wood. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs four staff members. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are traders from his town area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a cow of milk for selling. His business goal is to expand his retail business within five years. Benedictor's plan for his family is to educate his children and build them a house.

loan.use: To buy a dairy cow

loan.name: Fatoumata Sidi

texts.fr: Madame Fatoumata Sidi est 但g辿e de 42 ans, mari辿e et m竪re de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucl辿aire au quartier Hamdallaye de S辿gou. Ayant abandonn辿e l辿cole au secondaire (syst竪me 辿ducatif Malien), t担t elle embrassa le commerce aupr竪s de sa m竪re qui vendait des condiments et de lencense. Apr竪s plusieurs ann辿es dapprentissage son c担t辿, elle 辿volua seule pour faire le m棚me commerce. Elle m竪ne son activit辿 depuis maintenant 7 ans et jouit dune grande exp辿rience. Sa force de vente est due la qualit辿 de son produit. Elle vend sa marchandise au comptant et cr辿dit une client竪le compos辿e majoritairement de femmes. Dans le souci de faire face la demande client竪le et de faire plus de b辿n辿fice, elle sollicite ce nouveau pr棚t. elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 24 mois, avec 2 pr棚ts individuels bien rembours辿s. Elle sollicite ce 3竪me pr棚t pour acheter 50 kg de k辿ni et 20 bouteilles deaux de Cologne. Elle sapprovisionne sur place S辿gou. Madame Fatoumata Sidi envisage de r辿aliser un b辿n辿fice mensuel de 45 000FCFA. Ce b辿n辿fice lui permettra de rembourser son pr棚t, de mener dautres activit辿s g辿n辿ratrices de revenus. Son ambition est de p辿renniser son activit辿.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Sidi is 42 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her nuclear family in the Hamdallayein district of the town of S辿gou.
She left school during secondary level (in the Malian education system) and started working with her mother at a young age, selling condiments and incense. Having worked for several years as her mother卒s apprentice, Fatoumata Sidi struck out on her own, continuing in the same line of work. She has now been in this business for 7 years and is very experienced. The strength of her sales is due to the high quality of her product. She sells her merchandise for cash or credit to a clientele mostly composed of women.
Fatoumata Sidi is requesting a new loan so that she can better respond to customer demand and make more profits. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for of 24 months and has already fully repaid 2 previous individual loans. She is requesting this third loan so that she can buy 50g of gu辿ni (natural incense) and 20 bottles of Eau de Cologne. She gets her supplies locally, in S辿gou.
Fatoumata Sidi anticipates earning a monthly profit of 45 000 francs. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and pursue other revenue-generating activities. Her goal is to make her business sustainable.

loan.use: to buy ingredients needed to make incense.

loan.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou est 但g辿 de 41 ans, mari辿 et p竪re de 1 enfant, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec dautres m辿nages au quartier Hamdallaye de S辿gou. Mamadou est titulaire dun certificat daptitude professionnelle en d辿clarant en douane, mais faute demploi, il d辿cide de faire une reconversion afin de sins辿rer dans la vie 辿conomique. Cest ainsi quil commen巽a faire lapprenti cameraman aupr竪s des professionnelles de lOffice de Radio diffusion T辿l辿vision du Mali (O.R.T.M). Apr竪s plusieurs ann辿es leurs c担t辿s, il 辿volua seul pour faire le m辿tier de cameraman. Sa force de vente est due la qualit辿 de son service offert. Dans le souci de mieux s辿quiper pour faire face la demande client竪le, il sollicite ce pr棚t. Il est son 1er pr棚t avec Soro Yiriwaso et compte lutiliser pour payer une camera, il sapprovisionnera au Ghana. Il fait ses prestations au comptant une client竪le compos辿e de femmes et dhommes. Avec ce pr棚t, il envisage de r辿aliser un b辿n辿fice de 40 000FCFA par mois. Ce b辿n辿fice lui permettra de faire face la demande client竪le et de payer ses 辿ch辿ances avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou is 41 years old, and married with one child. He lives in a traditional family among other households in the district of Hamdallaye, in Segou. Mamadou holds a vocational training certificate as a customs officer, but due to a lack of employment opportunities, he opted to switch to a different career in order to enter the work force. He became an apprentice cameraman working with professionals at the Office for Radio and Television of Mali (ORTM). After several years of training, he branched out on his own to work as a cameraman. His main strength is in the quality of his services.
In order to be better equipped to meet customer demand, Mamadou is seeking his first loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to purchase a camera, which he plans to buy in Ghana. He works for cash, and his clientele consists of both men and women. He expects that this loan will help him to earn a profit of 40,000FCFA per month. This will allow him to handle customer demand and make loan repayments to Soro Yiriwaso.

loan.use: to buy a camera.

loan.name: Fatou Kin辿

texts.fr: Madame Fatou habite au S辿n辿gal. Elle est 但g辿e de 43 ans. Elle est mari辿e et m竪re de 5 enfants 但g辿s entre 8 et 26 ans. Elle sactive depuis plus de 10ans dans le secteur de la petite restauration et vend du petit d辿jeuner et du sandwich. En meme temps elle commercialise des tissus teint辿s, et des blousons. Elle a choisi son activit辿 de commerce pour 辿pauler son mari a supporter les charges familiales. Ce qui lint辿resse cest surtout laspect lucratif de cette activit辿. Elle est soci辿taire de lun des guichets de lU-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003. Elle sollicite un cr辿dit de 300 000 frs destin辿 a renforcer son fond de commerce pour augmenter le stock des produits quelle commercialise ( tissus teint辿s, blousons) dune part, dautre part elle compte renforcer son commerce de petit d辿jeuner en achetant en quantit辿 plus importante les denr辿es quelle utilise pr辿parer ses repas. Son souhait est daugmenter ses b辿n辿fices et dam辿liorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou lives in Senegal. She is 43, married and the mother of 5 children aged between 8 and 26. She has been working as a restaurateur for over 10 years and sells breakfasts and sandwiches. She also sells dyed fabrics and jackets. She chose her business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and she is especially interested in the profitable aspects of her work.
Fatou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since November 2003. She is requesting a 300 000 franc loan so that she can strengthen her business activities by restocking on the products that she sells (dyed fabrics and jackets) and buying larger quantities of the ingredients that she uses to make her breakfasts. She would like to increase her profits and improve her family's social situation.

loan.use: to buy fabric, jackets and food products for her business.

loan.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BADEGNA est compos辿 de femmes mari辿es qui ont une moyenne d但ge de 29 ans et de 4 enfants en moyenne. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames dans la ville de Bougouni, au quartier de M辿dine. Elles sont leur cinqui竪me pr棚t avec linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les pr辿c辿dents ont 辿t辿 correctement rembours辿s. Elles se sont connues par les liens de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et des fruits et l辿gumes. FANTA, est la pr辿sidente du groupe, elle est devant avec a un panier de tomate fra樽che contenant un peu de choux, sur son pied. Elle compte acheter, avec son pr棚t, 400 kg de tomate fra樽che, 300kg de choux et divers petits colis de condiments(fi竪fi竪, poivre, poudre de gombo et de Sounbala). Elle sapprovisionne Bamako avec les grossistes. Elle vend au grand march辿 de Bougouni et domicile une client竪le compos辿e essentiellement de femmes, en d辿tail, au comptant et cr辿dit. Elle compte r辿aliser un b辿n辿fice mensuel de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilis辿e pour soutenir les frais de sant辿 et d辿ducation des enfants et lautre partie sera investie dans les activit辿s.
texts.en:
The BADEGNA group consists of married women who average 29 years of age and four children each. They live in polygamous families in the city of Bougouni, located in the Medina district. They know one another as neighbors and through their trade. They sell food condiments, fruits and vegetables. This is their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans were repaid without problems.
FANTA is the president of the group. She is sitting at the front in the photo with a basket of fresh tomatoes and cabbage. She will use her loan to purchase 400 kg of fresh tomatoes, 300 kg of cabbage, and various small packets of condiments (fi竪fi竪, pepper, okra powder and Sounbala). She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in Bamako, and she conducts her sales at retail at the big market of Bougouni and from her home, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.
She expects to earn a monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, part of which is to be used to cover the costs of the childrens healthcare and education, and the remainder to be reinvested in her business.

loan.use: to buy condiments, fruits and vegetables for resale.

loan.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENDIYA sont toutes mari辿es, ont une moyenne d但ge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles 辿largies avec leurs fr竪res, surs, co-辿pouses, 辿poux et enfants. Elles r辿sident dans le village de SIDO, pr辿fecture de Bougouni (3竪me r辿gion administrative du Mali). Pour am辿liorer leurs activit辿s afin de mieux satisfaire les clients, elles ont fait recours linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec la quelle elles sont leur douzi竪me pr棚ts et tous les pr辿c辿dents ont 辿t辿 correctement rembours辿s. Ces femmes du groupe BENDIYA font le commerce de c辿r辿ales, de pagnes et de chaussures. Djakassan, deuxi竪me personne la photo qui souri avec une tasse de c辿r辿ales sur son pied, compte acheter avec son pr棚t, 300kg de ma誰s, 200kkg de petit mil et 250kg de fonio. Elle sapprovisionne dans le march辿 de SIDO avec les fournisseurs venus des villages environnants pour ensuite les revendre sur place en d辿tail et au comptant une client竪le compos辿e dhommes et de femmes. Elle envisage r辿aliser un b辿n辿fice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera investi dans les activit辿s.
texts.en: The members of the BENDIYA group are all married, are aged on average thirty-four years, and have an average of four children. They live in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, husbands, and children. They live in the village of SIDO in the prefecture of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. To improve their businesses in order to better satisfy their customers, they have appealed to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are at their twelfth loan with this institution, and all of their previous loans were properly repaid. The women from the BENDIYA group do business in grains, pagnes (colorful wax cloth) and shoes. Djakassan, the second person in the photo who is smiling and has a cup of grains at her feet, counts on buying with this loan 300kg of corn, 200kg of millet and 250kg of fonio (another type of millet). She stocks up in the SIDO market with the sellers who come from neighboring villages so that she can then resell on the premises to retail customers, both women and men. She imagines making a monthly profit averaging 45,000francs, which will be invested into her activity.

loan.use: to buy grains.

loan.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont toutes mari辿es, ont une moyenne d但ge de 26 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles 辿largies dans le village de SIDO, pr辿fecture de Bougouni (3竪me r辿gion administrative du Mali). Elles sont leur huiti竪me collaboration avec linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur client竪le. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des produits cosm辿tiques, de m竪ches, etc. CHATA, qui est la pr辿sidente du groupe ayant un paquet de m竪che tendu dans ses deux mains sur la photo, compte acheter avec son pr棚t, 400 paquets de m竪che de diverses qualit辿s avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre en d辿tail, au comptant et cr辿dit dans le march辿 de SIDO une client竪le compos辿e essentiellement de femmes. Elle envisage r辿aliser un b辿n辿fice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilis辿e pour entretenir les enfants et lautre partie sera investie dans les activit辿s.
texts.en: The members of the DEMBAGNOUMA group are all married, are aged on average twenty-six years, and have on average three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Sido, in the prefecture of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They are at their eighth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The group of women does business selling cosmetics, hair extensions, etc. Chata, who is the president of the group, with a packet of hair extensions in her hands in the photo, counts on buying 400 packs of hair extensions from the wholesalers in Bamako with this loan, which she will then sell retail, for cash and for credit, in the Sido market to a clientele essentially made up of women. She imagines making an average monthly profit of 50,000francs, of which one part will be used to look after her children and the other part will be invested in her occupation.

loan.use: to buy hair extensions.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to equip her canteen.

loan.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr: Compos辿 de quatre femmes mari辿es, les membres du groupe MIRIYA ont en moyenne 28 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles 辿largies avec leurs maris, 辿pouses, co辿pouses, fr竪res et fils. Elles r辿sident dans le village de SIDO, pr辿fecture de Bougouni (3竪me r辿gion administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des clients de voisinage, damiti辿 et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacit辿 financi竪re afin de mieux faire le stock, elles ont adh辿r辿 linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont leur douzi竪me pr棚t et tous les pr棚ts pr辿c辿dents ont 辿t辿 correctement rembours辿s. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce jus, de boissons sucreries. FANTA, pr辿sidente du groupe habill辿e en complet rouge但tre sur la photo compte acheter avec son pr棚t, 150 casiers de boisson non alcoolis辿es (sucrerie) avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre en d辿tail, au comptant et cr辿dit dans le march辿 de SIDO une client竪le compos辿e dhommes et de femmes. Elle envisage r辿aliser un b辿n辿fice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera investi dans les activit辿s.
texts.en: Made up of four married women, the members of the group MIRIYA are aged on average twenty-eight years and have an average of two children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons. They live in the village of Sido, in the prefecture of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They got to know each other from customers, being neighbors, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capacity, in order to better stock up, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and with which they are at their twelfth loan. All previous loans have been properly repaid. The group of women does business in juice and sweet drinks. Fanta, the president of the group, in the reddish outfit in the photo, counts on buying 150 bottle racks of non alcoholic drinks from wholesalers in Bamako with their loan, which she will then resell commercially, for cash and credit in the Sido market to a clientele made up of both men and women. She foresees making an average monthly profit of 40,000francs, which will be invested in her business.

loan.use: to buy drinks.

loan.name: Elizah

texts.en:
Elizah, 45 years old, is a dairy farmer in Mariakani. She is the married mother of two.
She has been selling milk to her customers for the past ten years successfully.
This marks her first loan business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to buy more dairy cattle and goats.
She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes to have a happy, successful family.

loan.use: to buy more dairy cattle and goats.

loan.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar est 但g辿 de 45 ans. Il vit au S辿n辿gal. Il est mari辿 et p竪re de 4 enfants dont l但ge varie entre 1et 7 ans. Il sactive depuis 1992 dans lenseignement coranique dans le quartier ou il habite. Ce qui lint辿resse le plus cest le savoir quil inculque aux enfants. Il est membre du guichet de lU-IMCEC de la localit辿 depuis octobre 2003. Il sollicite un cr辿dit de 150 000 pr辿vu pour soutenir ses fr竪res p辿cheurs qui ont des possibilit辿 tr竪s limit辿es et qui veulent entretenir leur pirogue qui est en 辿tat de d辿labrement avanc辿. Son objectif est daider ses fr竪res maintenir leur capacit辿 financi竪re a supporter les charges familiales.
texts.en: Monsieur Momar is forty-five years old. He lives in Senegal. He is married and the father of four children, whose ages range from one to seven years. He has been active since 1992 teaching the Koran in the area where he lives. What interests him the most is the knowledge that he imparts to the children. He has been a member of his UIMCEC branch since October 2003. He is asking for a loan of 150,000, anticipated to help his brothers, who are fishermen, who have very limited possibilities and want to take care of their canoe, which is badly in disrepair. His objective is to help his brothers maintain their financial capacity to support their family expenses.

loan.use: to help his brothers repair their canoe.

loan.name: Journy

texts.en: Journy is 30 years old, single and lives in Tapican, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Journy owned a sari-sari store for 1 year, earning PHP 5,000 monthly. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. Journy has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Journy hopes to expand his business.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loan.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has nine children.
Crisanta has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy bananas and coconuts for sale.
Crisanta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy bananas and coconuts for sale.

loan.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, ages 8 and 10. For the past year, she has run an M-pesa transaction service which is a cell phone-based money transfer service. Everlyne describes herself as social and focused. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are local residents and passersby. Everlyne's business challenge is inadequate float.
Everlyne is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to increase her transaction capital. She will deposit her loan in a Safaricom account. Everlyne's business goal is to run three similar businesses within the next five years.

loan.use: to increase her money transfer service

loan.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a hairdresser. She owns a beauty salon at Adum Banso. Monica has completed Junior High Senior. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a purching clerk. Hannah has been a hairdresser for 6 years. Her loan will be used to buy hair creams and wigs for hair dressing business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy hair creams and wigs for hair dressing business

loan.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
"Our business in life is not to get ahead of others, but to get ahead of ourselves." (E. Joseph Cossman).
Cresencia has been a businesswoman for one year. She is 52 years old and married. She resides at Aquino, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental and is blessed with four siblings at school age.
She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight months already and she borrowed money in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for additional business capital. Her business is a sari-sari store. She earns about Php 5,000 monthly in her business as profit. She improves her living conditions with the use of the profits.

loan.use: to use as business additional capital.

loan.name: Silveria

texts.en:
"The spirit, the will to win, and the will to excel are the things that endure. These qualities are so much more important than the events that occur." (Vince Lombardi).
Silveria has the strong determination to help her brother. She is 60 years old and married to Meguel, who is a government employee with a salary of Php 6,000, and she is blessed with a daughter.
She is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she borrowed money in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for pocket money for her brother who is going abroad.

loan.use: to give pocket money to her brother who is going abroad.

loan.name: Delfin

texts.en: Delfin lives in Pingol, Ozamiz City. He is 56 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. For more than 3 years, he has made a living by selling food & daily use products in the local community. He earns about 10,000 PHP a month from his work. In 2010, Delfin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for this loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand his product offering. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering.

loan.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 21-year-old married woman with four children ranging from 7 to 20 years old. For the past six years, she has operated a restaurant where she sells snacks, tea, and food. She also is a farmer who grows maize and green grams. Dorcas describes herself as innovative, creative, and aggressive. Her biggest business challenge is the high cost of buying ingredients to prepare food.
Dorcas is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, and green grams. Her business goal is to run a hotel where she can sell a variety of food within five years.

loan.use: to purchase flour, sugar, salt, and green grams

loan.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 8 children.
Rosalinda has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & candies. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more snacks, beverages & candies to sell.
Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: buy snacks, beverages & candies

loan.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children.
Berlinda has a vulcanizing shop that provides motor repairs & tire repairs, with her husband as the repairman. She has had this business for 10 years.
Berlinda requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the electricity for her business. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Berlinda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: buy tools & pay for electricity

loan.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson used his previous loan to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business. Since his dream is educating his children and increase his daily savings, he intends to buy more motorcycles and hire them out, having discovered this business as a direct answer to his dream. Wilson needs this loan to buy a second motorcycle for his transport business.

loan.use: buy a motorcycle

loan.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 27-year old married man with two children, living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He provides motorcycle transport services and has been in that business for six years. He also rears cattle. His challenge has been high fuel costs and accidents. His dream is to buy another motorcycle and expand his cattle farm. Godfrey needs this loan to to buy a cow for milking.

loan.use: buy a dairy cow

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To pay school fees for her two children who are in high school.

loan.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a forty-two-year-old married man with five children. He rears goats and grows flowers in Kangemi. Lucas has been in the business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.
This will be Lucas third loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more goats to rear and sell later at a profit,and also plant flowers for sell.
With the profit that he will get he wants to diversify in his business. In the future he wants to be able to expand his business and sustain his family by improving their standard of living

loan.use: to buy goats and pay school fees for his children.

loan.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 26-year-old modest lady from Lambwe town, Western Kenya. She is married to Patrick and they have two children. Caroline operates a home products stall in Lambwe town where she sells items such as water basins, buckets, cups and other utensils. She has been doing this for the last five years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from Kiva partner KADET, which she will use to buy a stock of home products such as basins and buckets. She will use her profits to purchase more stock. Her dream is to improve her living standards.

loan.use: to buy stocks of home products (such as basins and buckets) for resale.

loan.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 38 years old. She is married and has three children aged 15, 14 and 10. In 1998, she established her poultry farming business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy chickens for her business.
In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 0In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loan.use: to buy small chickens for her business.

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a petty trader. Some of the items she sells are fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, palm oil, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items at Adum Banso near Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and has five dependents. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their dependents.
Ekua will use her loan to purchase fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items for resale. With her new profit, Ama will expand Ekua business.

loan.use: to purchase fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items for resale.

loan.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a baker. She bakes bread for sale at Adum Banso. She is married to a teacher and has one child. Lydia has been baking for three years now. She supports her husband to feed and clothe their children.
She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for her bakery. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for her bakery.

loan.name: Sarait

texts.en: Sarait, 35, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over three years, earning approximately US $2.5 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who earns approximately US $3 per day. In order to develop her family's economy, Sarait is requesting a loan of US $350 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell as well as to repair motorbikes for his clients. By doing so, her husband will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her child to a good school.

loan.use: to purchase spare parts for her husband's business

loan.name: Lib 6 Sous Groupe 2

texts.fr: Al OUMA libert辿6 sous groupe 2 un regroupement de 13 membres qui adh竪rent tous dans la meme association lequel est un groupement national de solidarit辿. Cest un groupe de 11 femmes regroup辿s dans le meme secteur dactivit辿 de commerce divers. Elles sont repr辿sent辿es par madame Ndeye Aissatou qui repr辿sente la personne habill辿e en vert sur la photo. Elle sactive depuis plusieurs ann辿es dans le secteur du commerce de produits divers et de la couture. Elle capitalise une exp辿rience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activit辿s. Elle commence sa journ辿e a partir de 9 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 17 heures. Elle sollicite un cr辿dit pr辿vu pour l 損achat dhabits a revendre. Son objectif est de diversifier les produits et lhabillement quelle commercialise. Elle souhaite 辿largir sa part de march辿 et ouvrir dautres magasins afin de pouvoir maximiser ses b辿n辿fices.
texts.en:
Al OUMA Libert辿 6 sub-group 2 consists of 13 affiliates under the same association, which is a national solidarity group. This is a group of 11 women brought together in the same industry of diverse retail businesses.
They are represented by Ms. Ndetye Aissatou, depicted in the photo wearing green. She has been active for many years in retail dealing with various goods as well as clothing. She capitalizes on an experience of more than ten years in these sectors. She begins her days at 9:00 in the morning and returns home around 5:00 in the evening.
She is asking for a loan in order to purchase garments for resale. Her goal is to diversify her retail clothing products. She wishes to expand her market share and open other stores in order to maximize her profits.

loan.use: to purchase garments and various goods for resale.

loan.name: Al Ouma Lib 6Sous Groupe 1

texts.fr: Al OUMA libert辿6 sous groupe 1 est un regroupement de 11 membres qui adh竪rent tous dans la meme association lequel est un groupement national de solidarit辿. Cest un groupe de 11 femmes regroup辿s dans le meme secteur dactivit辿 de commerce divers. Elles sont repr辿sent辿es par madame Aissata qui repr辿sente la personne habill辿e en marron avec une voile sur la t棚te sur la photo. Elle sactive depuis plusieurs ann辿es dans le secteur du commerce de tissus et de la couture. Elle capitalise une exp辿rience d e plus de 15 ans dans ses activit辿s. Elle commence sa journ辿e a partir de 10 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 19 heures. Elle sollicite un cr辿dit pr辿vu pour lachat de tissus a confectionner et dautres produits comme sacs et chaussures dans le but de diversifier ses marchandises.. Son objectif est douvrir un magasin dans un futur proche.
texts.en:
Al Ouma Libert辿 6Sous Groupe 1 is made up of 11 members who all belong to the same association, a national solidarity group. It is a group of 11 women gathered together in the same sector, miscellaneous trade.
The women are represented by Ms. Aissata, the woman shown dressed in brown with a veil on her head in the photo. For several years, she has been very busy in the fabric and fashion trade. She makes the most of her experience of more than 15 years in this business. She begins her day at 10am, returning home around 7pm.
Ms. Aissata is seeking a loan intended for purchasing fabrics to prepare and other goods, such as bags and shoes, with the aim of diversifying her merchandise. Her intention is to open a shop in the near future.

loan.use: To purchase fabrics, bags, shoes and various goods to sell.

loan.name: Al Ouma Lib1, 2, 3, Sous Groupe 3

texts.fr: Al OUMA libert辿1, 2, 3, sous groupe 3 est un regroupement de 10 membres qui adh竪rent tous dans la meme association lequel est un groupement national de solidarit辿. Cest un groupe mixte de 9 femmes et un homme regroup辿s dans le meme secteur dactivit辿 de commerce divers. Ils sont repr辿sent辿es par madame Bernadette qui repr辿sente la personne habill辿e en rouge sur la photo. Elle sactive depuis plusieurs ann辿es dans le secteur de la transformation et du commerce darticles divers de femmes. Elle capitalise une exp辿rience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activit辿s. Elle commence sa journ辿e a partir de 9 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 18 heures. Elle sollicite un cr辿dit pr辿vu pour lachat de produits divers pour femmes marchandises. Son objectif est dacqu辿rir le fond n辿cessaire pour diversifier son activit辿.
texts.en: Al Ouma libert辿 1, 2, 3 (subgroup 3) is a group which consists of 10 members who have all joined the same national solidarity association. This is a mixed group, with 9 women and 1 man who are all involved in various trades. Bernadette is their representative, and she is the woman dressed in red in the photo. For several years now, she has been involved in the processing and the sale of various women's products. She has acquired over ten years of experience in these fields. She starts her day at 9 o'clock in the morning and returns home at about 6 o'clock in the evening. She is requesting a loan to purchase various women's products. Her goal is to acquire enough funding to diversify her activity.

loan.use: to buy women's products for resale.

loan.name: Al Ouma Lib 1, 2, ,3,sous Groupe 2

texts.fr: Al OUMA libert辿1, 2, 3, sous groupe 2 est un regroupement de 9 membres qui adh竪rent tous dans la meme association lequel est un groupement national de solidarit辿. Cest un groupe de 9 femmes regroup辿es dans le meme secteur dactivit辿 de la couture et de commerce de tissus et divers autres produits. Elles sont repr辿sent辿es par madame Fatou qui repr辿sente la personne habill辿e en jaune sur la photo. Elle sactive depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de tissus et produits divers. Elle capitalise une exp辿rience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activit辿s. Elle commence sa journ辿e a partir de 9 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle a 19 heures. Elle sollicite un cr辿dit pr辿vu pour lachat de tissus destin辿s renforcer son activit辿 de commerce. Elle souhaite dans lavenir diversifier son activit辿 le maximum possible.
texts.en: Al Ouma Libert辿 1, 2, 3, Sous Group 2 is a grouping of nine members who all belong to the same association which is a national solidarity group. This group of nine women are in the same business sector of sewing, fabric, and various other products. Fatou, the person dressed in yellow in the photo, represents the women. For more than ten years she has been very involved with the fabric business and of various other products. She capitalizes on her experience of more than ten years in these businesses and begins her day from 9 in the morning in order to return home by 7 in the evening. She seeks a planned loan to buy fabric intended to reinforce her commerce activity. She wishes to diversify her business as much as possible in the future.

loan.use: to buy fabric and a variety of articles to sell.

loan.name: Al Ouma Lib1, 2, 3, Sous Groupe 4

texts.fr: Al OUMA libert辿1, 2, 3, sous groupe 4 est un regroupement de 7 membres qui adh竪rent tous dans la meme association lequel est un groupement national de solidarit辿. Cest un groupe de 7 femmes regroup辿es dans le meme secteur dactivit辿 de la couture et de commerce de tissus et divers autres produits. Elles sont repr辿sent辿es par madame Aissatou qui repr辿sente la personne habill辿e en vert sur la photo. Elle sactive depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de tissus et produits divers. Elle capitalise une exp辿rience d e plusieurs ann辿es dans son activit辿. Elle commence sa journ辿e a partir de 10 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle 19 heures. Elle sollicite un cr辿dit pr辿vu pour lachat de tissus et de produits cosm辿tiques puisquelle a lintention de diversifier les produits quelle commercialise. Son objectif principal est de renforcer son activit辿 de commerce.
texts.en: Al Ouma Libert辿 1, 2, 3, Sous Group 4 is a grouping of seven members who all belong to the same association which is a national solidarity group. This group of seven women are in the same business sector of sewing, fabric, and various other products. Aissatou, the person dressed in green in the photo, represents the women. For more than ten years she has been very involved in the fabric business and of various other products. She capitalizes on her experience of several years in her business and begins her day from 10 in the morning in order to return home by 7 in the evening. She seeks a planned loan to buy fabric and cosmetics since she intends to diversify the products that she sells. Her main objective is to reinforce her commerce activity.

loan.use: to buy fabric and other various products to sell.

loan.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
Bevelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits, milk, coffee, shampoos and soap. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more goods like canned goods biscuits and all food products to sell.
Bevelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bevelyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy more good lto sell like canned goods, biscuits, and other food products to sell

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has seven children ranging from fifteen to eighteen years old. She describes herself as self-motivated and aggressive. She has been involved in dairy farming where she sells milk to repeat customers. In addition, she does farming to increase her income. Her business challenge is the high cost of cow feed.
Margaret will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy three bags of cow feed and milk storage containers. In the next five years, Margaret hope to be the best supplier of milk and have three more cows.

loan.use: to buy three bags of cow feed and milk storage containers.

loan.name: Fredy Boanerge

texts.es: Fredy, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus dos hijos, sus hijos dependen de 辿l; Fredy administra una tienda de productos dom辿sticos, esta surgi坦 por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario establecido y cuenta con experiencia. l est叩 solicitando un pr辿stamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, como frijoles, huevos, aceite, esta compra le permitir叩 tener m叩s disponibilidad para la clientela, ampliando el negocio para satisfacer la demanda. La aspiraci坦n de Fredy es que su negocio sea prospero, para poder de esta manera generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy lives with his family, his wife, and his two children. His children depend on him. Fredy runs a store that sells household items, which he began on his own initiative. He does not have a fixed schedule and is experienced.
He is asking for a loan for the purchase of essential items, like beans, eggs, and oil. This purchase will allow him to have more available for the customer, expanding the business to satisfy demand.
Fredy's goal is for his business to be lucrative so that through this he can make money for his family.

loan.use: to purchase beans, eggs, and oil.

loan.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a thirty-eight-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a big car that transports people and their products to Kamwenge markets as a source of income. His challenges are high fuel and transportation costs and poor roads subjecting his car to repair expenses all the time. His dream is educating his children and buying land to grow crops. Stephen needs this loan to buy tires for his car.

loan.use: buy tires

loan.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 48-year-old, hardworking lady with 6 children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a personal goal of buying a car. She has been dealing in clothes-selling for the last 10 years. After starting with capital of 100,000 UGX, Ruth now has 3,000,000 UGX. Her major hardship is seasonal weather. However, she has a vision of moving her business to a more permanent location. Ruth needs a loan to help her buy clothes for resale.

loan.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loan.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is married and has 4 children. He is 60 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.
Luciano operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for 12 years. Each month, he earns 4,600 PHP doing this type of business.
Luciano requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to repair his fishing boat. In 2011, he joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Luciano wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loan.use: repair his fishing boat

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 56 years old and married to a businessman. They have 4 children, whose ages range from 21 years to 36 years. She describes herself as an industrious woman. She operates a pig farm where she sells pigs and pork. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in a viable and busy area. Her customers are schools. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ten piglets. Sarah's business goal is to run a pork butcher shop within 5 years. Sarah hopes that, in the future, she will be the area's leading supplier of meat.

loan.use: to purchase ten piglets.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Joseph. He is married, and has 4 children aged 14, 11, 6, and 2yrs. Joseph established his provision business. He began his business because he wanted to get a reliable source of income which he can use to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.Joseph now requires a new loan in order to purchase more provision for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Joseph plans to open stores in different market areas and educate his children to university level. He is thanking you for your support.

loan.use: To buy more used clothing for his business.

loan.name: Mareidel

texts.en:
Mareidel is 32 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is married with one school-aged child.
To earn a living, Mareidel has a business selling of different kinds of viands (prepared dishes). She earns about 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Mareidel has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc.
Mareidel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Mareidel would like to save money for the future.

loan.use: to purchase more ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc.

loan.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 24 years old and married with one child.
He runs a hardware shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for one year and employs three people.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tiles to sell.

loan.use: to buy tiles to sell

loan.name: Janneth Cecilia

texts.es:
Janneth ha trabajado durante gran parte de su vida con el 叩nimo de sacar su familia adelante. Anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo morcilla en su municipio, pues los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, y gracias a esto la gente del pueblo logr坦 conocerla. Posteriormente, un amigo suyo que preparaba pizzas en un carrito de comidas tuvo que abandonar el municipio, por lo que le ense単坦 a Janneth la actividad y le dej坦 su carrito de comidas, a partir de esto Janneth sigui坦 elaborando las pizzas ya que esto le dejaba mejores ingresos. Ahora que Janneth es reconocida por las personas de su municipio sus ventas son muy buenas, hasta el punto que a veces su negocio no tiene la capacidad de preparar las pizzas para tantas personas que le compran. Es por esto que Janneth quiere cambiar su carrito de comidas, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de este, por lo que aspira a que un pr辿stamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un carrito de comidas para preparar pizza y a la compra utensilios de cocina para la preparaci坦n de las pizzas.
Janneth sue単a con tener un gran local donde pueda atender a muchas personas y donde pueda estar cubierta si empieza a llover. Adem叩s, sue単a con que sus hijos tengan una buena educaci坦n y puedan tener una estabilidad econ坦mica que les permita tener mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Janneth has worked for most of her life with the intention of getting her family ahead. Before she worked selling blood sausage in her town, since the income generated by her husband wasn't enough to sustain their home. Thanks to this, the people of the town got to know her. Later on, a friend of hers who made pizzas in a food cart had to leave town, so he taught Janneth the work and left her his food cart. Since then, Janneth continued making pizzas since this gave her a greater income.
Now that she is recognized by the townspeople her sales are very good--to the point where sometimes her business doesn't have the capacity to make pizzas for all the people who want to buy from her. It is because of this that Janneth wants to change her food cart. However, she doesn't have sufficient capital to buy this, so she is hoping that a loan will provide her with the opportunity to purchase a food cart to make pizzas and to buy kitchen utensils for making the pizzas.
Janneth dreams of having a big place where she can wait on many people and where she can be covered if it starts to rain. Furthermore, she dreams that her children receive a good education and that they have economic stability that allows them greater opportunities for progress.

loan.use: to buy a food cart to make pizza, and to buy kitchen utensils for making pizzas.

loan.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past year, John has been working hard to manage his small shop, which does produce in food.
To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for produce, and will help John to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. John hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses.
John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loan.use: to buy more food for produce

loan.name: Atambula Empola Zakaliya Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Moses has been a retail trader for the last five years. The father of five plies his trade in Kayunga. He deals principally in general merchandise retail commodities such as sugar, salt, plastics, rice, beans, etc. On the side, too, he practices farming. Week In, week out, he says his sales revenue equals to UGX 150,000.
Moses says he intends to use his loan money to purchase more goods: sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, and maize flour to resell.

loan.use: to purchase more goods: sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, and maize flour to resell.

loan.name: Adolfo Arnoldo

texts.es:
Don Adolfo tiene 44 a単os de edad, es soltero y vive con su mam叩. Desde los 15 a単os de edad trabaja en la agricultura en fincas de caf辿, cultivos frutales, entre otros, 辿l trabaja muy fuerte para ayudar a su mam叩 y salir adelante.
Los abonos qu鱈micos que necesita para mantener los cultivos, los compra en la ciudad m叩s cercana, para abordar el autob炭s que lo conduzca ah鱈, tiene que caminar a pie durante cuarenta y cinco minutos.
Don Adolfo solicita el financiamiento a Fundaci坦n Campo, para comprar 4 quintales de abono y follares para mantener el cultivo de pl叩tanos que posee y la finca de caf辿.
Con la inversi坦n aprovechara los recursos que posee, ya que cuenta con cultivos de pl叩tanos, naranjas y finca de caf辿s, para abonarlas y que le produzcan una buena cosecha, para que sus ingresos sean mejores y brindarle lo necesario a su mam叩 ya que tiene una avanzada edad.
Don Adolfo tiene pensado construir una casa de ladrillo e instalar la energ鱈a el辿ctrica, adem叩s darle las mejores condiciones a su mam叩.
texts.en:
Don Adolfo is 44 years old. He is single, and lives with his mom. Since the age of 15, he has worked in agriculture in coffee plantations and with fruit crops among others. He works very hard to support his mother and to move ahead in life.
He purchases the chemical fertilizers that he needs to maintain his crops in the nearest city. In order to catch the bus that goes there, he has to walk 45 minutes.
Don Adolfo is requesting financing from Fundaci坦n Campo to purchase four quintales (about 400 lb total) of fertilizers and foliant insecticide to maintain his plantain crop and coffee plantation. With the investment he will be able to take advantage of the resources that he possesses, as he has plantain and orange crops, and a coffee plantation. He will be able to fertilize them and they will produce a good harvest, so that his income is better and he can provide his mom with what she needs as she is of an advanced age.
Don Adolfo has been thinking about building a stone house and installing electricity, and also providing better conditions for his mom.

loan.use: to purchase four quintales (about 400 lb total) of fertilizers and foliant insecticide to maintain his plantain crop and coffee plantation.

loan.name: Lodivina

texts.en: Lodivina is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store and farming, selling a variety of different products in the local community and per cropping she is selling corn . She has been engaged in her farming business for over six years to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow for her farming business.

loan.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is very cooperative and supports her family by working as a farmer. She is still very efficient at the age of 43 and also performs her household duties very well. Her husband is a farmer and they help each other. Elisa is the mother of a son and a daughter.
Elisa has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner for her farming business. With the loan investment, she will buy farming supplies such as seeds and fertilizers, which will allow her to get maximum output from her land and increase her income.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to grow her farming business

loan.name: Angoritas 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. ANGORITAS DE 25 DE JULIO iniciar叩 su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, est叩 compuesta por ocho integrantes y est叩 dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la se単ora Julia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociaci坦n comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado. Tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, artesan鱈a, transporte p炭blico.
La se単ora Julia, indica que es el primer a単o que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la instituci坦n por invitaci坦n de una de las promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesan鱈a que viene trabajando hace a単os.
El cr辿dito que ahora sacar叩 es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirir叩 la agencia distribuidora, por mayor, y posterior a la elaboraci坦n lo vender叩 en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qu辿 le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitaci坦n y salud.
En la fotograf鱈a no aparese la se単ora Carmen, ya que ella tuvo que incorporarse inmediatamente a su fuente laboral.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Angoritas de 25 de Julio" will take their second loan with Pro Mujer. The group is part of the Andes regional office and is made up of eight members. It is run by a board headed by Julia. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Among them are fish sales, blanket weaving, vegetable sales, handicrafts, and public transport.
Julia states that this is her first year working with Pro Mujer and she came to the institution through the invitation of one of the facilitators. Currently she has a handicrafts business that she has worked in for years.
The loan she is taking now will be used to increase her capital (purchasing wool) which she will get from the distribution agency at wholesale. After making her items she will sell them from her home. This for of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has two children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and health.
Carmen is not pictured in the photograph as she had to had leave immediately for work.

loan.use: to buy wool.

loan.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Agricultural business has been the main primary source of income of Zenaida's family. She is 40 years old and happily married.The couple is thankful because they are blessed with three children who goes to school.
Zenaida have been operating her two hectares of rice field for almost 20 years.She would like to develop her agricultural business so that she could gain more income.Due to shortage of capital,Zenaida would like to borrow loan amount of P50,000 which will be use in buying fertilizer and insecticides to improve the growth of raised crops. This loan amount will really help her to earn for greater profit to be able to ensure sustainable future of her family.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farming business

loan.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a happy man. His boutique business has improved. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He is now applying for his second loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He intends to use the loan to stock up his business with more hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes.
He will save the anticipated profit and help take care of his children. In the future, Ernest hopes to expand his shop and also venture into other businesses.

loan.use: to stock up his business with more hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes.

loan.name: Kambeng De Diende Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kambeng de Diend辿 est cr辿辿 en 2008 linauguration du banc villageois. Il est compos辿 de 15 femmes qui habitent le m棚me quartier. Ces membres sont tr竪s dynamiques. Elles ont comme activit辿 principale le petit commerce.
Madame Sir辿, (debout au milieu du groupe, de bleu v棚tue, et levant la main), est responsable du groupe. Elle est 但g辿e de 40 ans, est mari辿e et m竪re de 05 enfants. Elle est g辿rante dune boutique dans son quartier, avec a son actif plus de 20 ans dexp辿rience dans ce domaine.
Avec ce pr棚t elle va renouveler son stock de marchandises (riz, huile, sucre, th辿 etc.) afin de faire cro樽tre son chiffre daffaire.
Avec les b辿n辿fices r辿alis辿s, elle d辿sire donner ses enfants un meilleur encadrement surtout au niveau scolaire.
texts.en:
The group Kambeng de Diend辿 was created in 2008 upon the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of 15 very dynamic women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small trade.
Mrs. Sir辿 (standing second from the left and raising her hand) is the group leader. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a shop in her neighborhood, and she has over 20 years of experience in this activity.
With her loan, she will replenish her stock to bolster her sales.
She will use her profits to better provide for her children, especially with respect to educational support.

loan.use: renouveler son stock de marchandises (riz, huile, sucre, th辿 etc.) afin de faire cro樽tre son chiffre daffaire.

loan.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una emprendedora luchadora que ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo ha emprendido este negocio de la pulper鱈a pero adem叩s a innovado nuevas l鱈neas de productos como venta de mercader鱈a en general y desinfectante para piso, lo cual ella nos expresa que gracias al financiamiento ha aumentado su mercader鱈a ofreci辿ndole a sus cliente variedad de producto. Actualmente est叩 solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos b叩sicos, aceite, jab坦n, verduras, detergentes entre otros productos.
texts.en: Mercedes is a tenacious entrepreneur who has gotten ahead in life with many efforts. She has opened her grocery store, and on top of this she has also introduced new lines of activities such as selling general products and disinfectants for apartments. She told us that thanks to the previous loan she has bought more products, thus offering her customers a wider variety of items. She is currently requesting a loan to invest it in her activity by buying basic grains, oil, ham, vegetables and detergents among other products.

loan.use: basic grains, oil, ham, vegetables and detergents.

loan.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children, a son and a daughter. He describes himself to be God fearing and honest.
Shaban operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents.
His business challenge is a shortage of charcoal. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. His business goal is to be a distributor of charcoal and own several similar charcoal retail stores within five years.
Shaban's hope in the future is to buy a property to venture into a new business of providing rental housing services.

loan.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old married man who has operated a retail business for a period of 3 years now. He started with money he got from brick selling, a business he operated first. He faces the problems of price fluctuation and inadequate capital. He would like to build a permanent house, educate his children and diversify his business into other markets. Joseph needs the loan facility to buy cooking oil, sodas, beers and beans for resale.

loan.use: to buy cooking oil, sodas, beers and beans for resale.

loan.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a thirty-one-year-old man from Homabay County situated along the shores of Lake Victoria and is married to Edgar and they have two children aged two and five years.
Ben operates a motor vehicle spare parts shop in Homabay, a business he has been doing for the last three years, and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more stock of motor vehicle spare parts. He will use the profits to expand the business.
His dream is to use his income to educate his children.

loan.use: To buy stock of motor vehicle spare parts.

loan.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 32 years old. She is married to Peter and together they have two children. She operates a cyber and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 12,500 from the business.
This is her first loan from KADET LTD . She will use the loan to purchase a computer for her business. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client.Her dream is to own rental houses.

loan.use: to purchase a computer

loan.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a male adult of 42 years who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married and has 8 children. Deo runs a business of selling local brew and produce, which he has operated for 10 years now. He started by farming, and then he got money which he used to buy local brew, which is a steadily growing business. He faces a problem of high transportation costs and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. He would like to diversify into other businesses like cattle - raising animals. Deo intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loan.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loan.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno is 42 years old and married with 3 children living in Masindi, Uganda.
For the last 1 and a half years he has been operating a retail shop. He started the business with his salary savings earned as a civil servant. His dream is to educate children and build a permanent house. He is challenged by customers not paying on time, inadequate capital and high taxes. Bruno wants a loan to buy sodas, water and beer to resell.

loan.use: to buy beer, water and sodas to sell.

loan.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hardworking mother of 3 children living in Hioma, Uganda.
She owns a beauty salon and has been doing this for 7 years. She faces hardships of price fluctuations and hopes to expand her business to new markets. Her family goal is to educate her children.
Florence needs a loan to buy cosmetics for use in her salon.

loan.use: to buy cosmetics for use in her salon.

loan.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Michael is 39 years old and married two children living in Masindi, Uganda. For the last nine years he has been dealing in phones and accessories. He started by hawking phones and after saving enough he rented an outlet. His dream is to educate his children and save for a wedding.
He is challenged by customers not paying on time and the high cost of rent. Micheal wants a loan to buy phones for resale.

loan.use: to buy phones for resale.

loan.name: Hugo

texts.es: El se単or Hugo tiene 50 a単os de edad vive en la poblaci坦n del municipio de Chimor辿 provincia Carrasco de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el convive con la se単ora Mar鱈a junto a sus hijos, 辿l tiene el oficio de alba単il y tambi辿n ayuda a su esposa Mar鱈a en el puesto de venta del K鱈nder. Por desgracia como muchos Hugo cayo en el vicio de la bebida y fue despoj叩ndose de sus cosas e incluso haciendo a un lado a su familia, pero el tiempo y la responsabilidad de mantener su familia hizo que Hugo siente cabeza y se preocupe por el bienestar de los suyos, siendo que empez坦 a trabajar solo y fue ganando m辿ritos con los conocidos de su esposa quienes lo requer鱈an mucho por sus obras, en un tiempo alcanzo a dirigir equipos de construcci坦n lo que fue su mayor distracci坦n y as鱈 se olvid坦 poco a poco del del vicio en el que cayo, ahora tiene buena reputaci坦n en su trabajo y consigue contratos que le hacen alcanzar mayores ingresos y mejores situaciones para vivir junto a su familia. Ahora solicita un cr辿dito con el que har叩 operar a su esposa de la vejiga ya que ella est叩 un poco pasada de peso, quien tuvo molestias de la vejiga desde hace tiempo y por falta de dinero no pudo hacerse un chequeo y control m辿dico, la se単ora aporta mucho en su familia ya que con la venta en el k鱈nder mantiene apaliados muchos gastos y ah鱈 es donde tiene los contactos para los contratos para Hugo. Mar鱈a esta consiente que fue un descuido por su parte, ahora ella y su esposo solicitan un cr辿dito para mejorar su salud y hacerse intervenir en una operaci坦n no muy complicada y as鱈 poder seguir atendiendo su venta y mantener su familia sin perjuicios en sus quehaceres, de tal forma que para Hugo lo primero es la salud y sin contar con un seguro de salud 辿l se decidi坦 a pagar la operaci坦n de su esposa y pagar en cuotas el cr辿dito lo m叩s antes posible. Hugo anhela que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor que el que tuvo que peregrinar, sacar a sus hijos del bachillerato y luego encaminarlos en estudios superiores ser叩n su pr坦xima meta y trabajara muy duro y har叩 lo posible para que esta situaci坦n se haga realidad y vea sus hijos en lo futuro con sus vidas m叩s plenas y mejoradas.
texts.en:
Hugo is 50 years old. He lives in the municipality of Chimor辿, province of Carrasco, in the city of Cochabamba. He lives together with Mar鱈a Magdalena and their children. He works as a mason, and he also helps his wife Mar鱈a in her sales stand at a kindergarten. Unfortunately, like many men, Hugo fell into the vice of drinking, and he was neglecting his affairs and even putting his family aside. But time and the responsibility for maintaining his family led Hugo to come to his senses and concern himself more with the well-being of his loved ones. Thus he began working alone, without friends, and he built up a good reputation with his wife's acquaintances, who needed him often for their projects. Over time he advanced to managing construction teams, which was his best distraction, and thus he forgot little by little the problem that lede him to neglect his own situation and that of his family. Now he has a good reputation in his work, and he obtains contracts that give him a better income and let him provide better living conditions for his family. Now he is requesting a loan which he will use to pay for a bladder operation for his wife, since she is a bit overweight and she has been having trouble with her bladder for some time, but the lack of money prevented her from getting medical checkups. She contributes greatly to the family, since with the sales stand at the kindergarten she covers a lot of expenses, and this is also where she finds the contacts for Hugo's work contracts. Mar鱈a realizes that this was negligence on her part, but now she and her husband are requesting a loan to improve her health; she will undergo an operation that is not very complicated, and then she will be able to continue operating her sales stand and maintaining her family without hindrances to her daily activities. For Hugo, health comes first, and without having health insurance, he decided to pay for his wife's operation and pay off the loan in installments as quickly as possible.
Hugo's desire is that his children will have a future that is better than the path he had to travel. He wants to help them finish an advanced high school degree, and his next goal will be to set them on their path with higher education. He will work very hard and do everything possible to make this a reality, so he can see his children in the future with lives that are full and improved.

loan.use: to pay for his wife's bladder operation.

loan.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
弌亠亞亠亶 亠仄亠-亠仍从仂仂亰磺于亠仆仆亳从. 丕亢亠 8 仍亠 仂仆 于仄亠亠 亠仄亠亶 亰舒仆亳仄舒亠 于舒亳于舒仆亳亠仄 舒仆仆亳 仂于仂亠亶 亟仍 仂仗仂于仂亶 仗仂亟舒亢亳 于 舒亰仆 仂弍仍舒 丕从舒亳仆. 舒 1 亞亠从舒亠 亰亠仄仍亳 弌亠亞亠亶 于舒亳于舒亠 3 仂仆仆 舒仆仆亠亞仂 亠亟亳舒, 20 000 从仂于 仗亠舒, 20 000 亞仂仍仂于 从舒仗, 10 000 从仂于 仗仂仄亳亟仂, 2 000 从仂于 仂亞仂于, 舒 舒从亢亠 6 000 从仂于 从舒弍舒从仂于. 舒 于亠 亞仂亟 舒弍仂 弌亠亞亠亶 于仍仂亢亳仍 于 于仂亠 亟亠仍仂 仂从仂仍仂 100 000 亞亳于亠仆. 亟仆舒从仂 亠亞仂 亳舒 仗亳弍仍 仆亠仄仆仂亞亳仄 弍仂仍亠 5 000 亞亳于亠仆.
亠亟亳 仂 仗仂亰于仂仍亳 弌亠亞亠 仗亳仂弍亠亳 亠仄亠仆舒 亟仍 仗仂亠于舒 仆舒 6 000 亞亳于亠仆, 仆亠仂弍仂亟亳仄亠 亟仂弍亠仆亳 仆舒 仄仄 4 000 亞亳于亠仆, 舒 舒从亢亠 仗仂仂亳 亟仂仗仂仍仆亳亠仍仆 亠仗仍亳 仆舒 6 000 亞亳于亠仆 亳 从仗亳 仗仂仍亳亳仍亠仆仂于 仗仍亠仆从 仆舒 4 000 亞亳于亠仆. 亠仍亠, 亞亟亠 弌亠亞亠亶 亢亳于亠 于仄亠亠 亠仄亠亶 仂亠仆 仄舒仍仂 于舒亳舒仆仂于 亟仍 亟仂仂亶于舒. 仂仂仄 亰舒仆亳亠 亠仍从亳仄 仂亰磺于仂仄 仗亠亟仂舒于仍磳 仂亶 亠仄亠 舒从亳亠 仆亠仂弍仂亟亳仄亠 亠亟于舒 亟仍 亠于仂于舒仆亳. 仂仄亠从舒: 亳仂亳 仆舒 从仂仄 磶从亠
texts.en:
Sergei is a farmer-agriculturalist. For eight years already, he and his family have been growing early vegetables for wholesale in various provinces across Ukraine. On 1 hectare of land, Sergei raises 3 tons of early radish, 20,000 pepper bushes, 20,000 head of cabbage, 10,000 tomato bushes, 2,000 cucumber plants, and 6,000 squash plants. Over all the years of his work, Sergei has invested about 100,000 hryven (UAH) in his farm. However, his net profit has been a little more than 5,000 hryven.
The loan he gets through Kiva will make it possible for Sergei to buy seed in the amount of 6,000 hryven, the necessary fertilizers in the amount of 4,000 hryven, to build an additional greenhouse for 6,000 hryven, and to buy polyethylene film for 4,000. There are very few alternatives for employment in the village where Sergei and his family live. And so, farming is what gives this family the wherewithal to live.
Note: story in Russian

loan.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, to build an additional greenhouse, and to buy polyethylene film

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 34 years old, married with one child. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes, beans, bananas and maize to sell.

loan.use: To buy potatoes, beans, bananas, tomatoes and maize to sell

loan.name: Charity

texts.en:
